We ordered the escargot and steak tartare as appetizers. Both were very good. Although I wish the escargot was a bit less oily, otherwise it tasted great with the bread rolls. My husband and I love using the sauce from almost any dish for bread dipping.

For entrees, I ordered the Confit de Canard ( the duck leg). It was very tender and savory. My husband ordered the Faux Filet ( New York steak with bone marrow herb-butter). The steak was also very tender and tasty. We also had some red wine with our meals. Altogether the bill was just a little over $100.
author: Krystal A.

description:
I love this place. There is an atmosphere that seems to be lacking in most restaurants nowadays. The steak tartare was phenomenal; wine was exquisite; cheese plate was to die for. 
The server was enthusiastic (maybe a little too much) and attentive.
The only complaint I have is the lack of lighting. I know that the dimness of the room adds ambiance, but it was so dark that I had to pull out my iPhone to see my entree (which was delicious and soaked in wine). This was just silly and embarrassing! 
I will be coming back. This is the kind of place that attracts real food lovers and the great atmosphere is partly due to the fact that there are no screaming kids....
I love cafe claude!
author: Ariana V.

description:
This place made me feel like I was back in the streets of France.  They have live jazz on Thursday nights, which goes along nicely with the meal.  

Came with two other girls and we all ordered the coq au vin.  The chicken fell off the bone.  Delicious!

Got the Fraternite cocktail with muddled cucumber and mint.  It was refreshing with a nice kick.  I love me a yummy, strong drink!

This place would be perfect for a date night...
author: Jenny L.

description: Excellent service, modest bistro menu that is done very well and good bistro vibe. If you want a French Bistro in the heart of the Financial District you can't go wrong. Prices are reasonable as well
author: Dan M.

description: Delicious food and cocktails, and wonderful service! Especially recommend the coq au vin, the steak tartare, and the escargots.
author: Thibaut D.

description:
Tucked away in a little, quiet street, Cafe Claude is one of my favorite restuarants for French.  I have been searching all over for porc au miel (pork cutlet in a honey sauce) since I had it in France.  I am so excited to have found this in the city.  The ambiance is romantic, making it a great place for a date.

1 star off: dirty bathroom

I really wanted to give them 5 stars too!  Stinkin'!  Um, literally.
author: Ally W.

description:
The honest truth is, even if I hadn't eaten anything, or had anything to drink, the service at this restaurant was so terrific I still would have given it four stars. 

But I did drink! A terrific glass of Gamay, you should try this too!
But I did eat! And here's the four stars. The food came to the table ridiculously fast...almost TOO fast. So fast I felt like there was no way it could have been made right then and there. I'm a leisurely eater, so I took smaller bites.

We ate snails (my partner was a first-timer) and they were lovely, except the puff pastry on top was unnecessary and not puffy (and looked weird). But the sauce was super and great for bread dipping. We also ate cod with swiss chard, which was very well done but unexciting, and crispy duck leg on lentils, which was so delicious we also tackled the server when she tried to take the plate away with lentil sauce still on the plate.

So two good but not super dishes, one super dish, and an apple tart, which had an amazing caramel sauce, but the tart itself was hard to cut and did not taste fresh.

My partner would like to add that it was not nearly as "nose-uppy" as he thought it would be, which is a bonus. Not nose-uppy but with low lamp charm.
author: Alameda L.

description:
Walking up to Cafe Claude is like finding a Parisian oasis within blocks of busy Union Square. Tucked away in an alleyway where this restaurant got its name, is a cafe with an inviting patio area right on the street. Inside is a cozy interior marked by a curved zinc bar, period posters and vintage tables. The atmosphere welcomes intimate conversations but keep it PG since the tables are close together.

The cocktail list enticed me with a barrage of choices: do I go for my favorite vesper or try one of the pastis drinks? Absinthe and Pernod aren't usually my top choices in a cocktail but the combinations they included in their drinks were enough to pique my interest. I eventually went with a more classic drink, a French 75 made with sparking wine, gin, grenadine and lemon juice. Perfect for brunch and won't make me loopy before my hair appointment.

Carb watchers, beware. They serve Acme bread that you can chew on while you wait. (yes, I saw the delivery guy on my way out!)  Try your very best to resist. 

The bistro menu remains true to their French roots with French onion soup, quiche Lorraine, croque madame, etc. The cream of mushroom was a special of the day and it was supreme! especially with a drizzle of truffle oil and sprinkling of fresh chives. 

My Albacore tuna salad sammy with lettuce, hard boiled egg, olives and anchovies were piled between thick rosemary ciabatta bread. The serving wasn't huge, but I was fully satisfied. I actually didn't have room for dessert.

Service was so much better than our previous brunch experience at Cafe dela Presse just down the block. Our server let us be, since we had months worth of catching up to do, but was present when we needed her. 

The next time I need another dose of Parisian flavor in my life, I won't hesitate to think of Cafe Claude. It's warm and comforting, like my friend who met me for brunch here yesterday.
author: Janice C.

description: Lovely spot in the alley. Live their chèvre salad. Good service, yummy bread. Music in the evenings- good all around.
author: Natasha M.

description:
A neighborhood spot in a somewhat touristy area, but I don't count that against them.  Definitely a number of French speaking folks on hand, which is nice to see.  (The couple next to us were from France and spoke very limited English.)

For our first (1 of 2) dinners on New Year's Eve, we had a nice, 3 course fixed menu.  Not quite worth the $95 per head, but totally acceptable given the occasion.  The salad, beef, and dessert were simple but superb.  With minimal extras, alcohol, and tip we ended up around  $150 per person.
author: Chris E.

description:
The first time I had a french meal was at Cafe Claude, organized by my high school French class.  It was a end-of-the-year farewell dinner.  I don't remember what I ate, but I remember trying to order in French and whispered in such an inaudible voice that the waiter had no clue what I was saying. 

Then I came again years later.  Still cannot recall what I ordered, but the Jazz was intoxicating.  The ambiance super romantic. 

Finally a third time.  The ambiance is still there.  The service equally friendly.  The food, however, was only okay.  What I liked were the fries.  Crisp, and came with this addictive spicy dip.  Salade Nicoise was only okay.  The tuna tasted like it came from a corner store deli.  And everything was haphazardly tossed together where distinctive tastes of each element, the potatoes, the haricot vert, the hard boiled eggs, start to get all mixed up in an unpleasant, soggy way. 

My friend tried the soup and the cod souffle.  She said that soup was good. I tried her souffle and it was way too salty. 

Maybe Cafe Claude hasn't changed at all in the past decade.  Maybe my palate has just been spoiled by all the fantastic restaurants in SF.  Or maybe I simply ordered the wrong dish.
author: Candice B.

description:
After experiencing the wonder of Chapeau! on Clement street, me and my best friend were expecting delicious french food.  We were very disappointed.  The bread they brought out tasted like day old Ralph's baguettes and had to be gnawed through.  We then started with the pommes frites which were greasy and McDonald's-esque and the onion soup which was edible but not delicious.  For the entree I had the cod which was so overcooked that it was practically mush.  It was surrounded by stewed tomatoes and red peppers that were barely seasoned and also mushy.  Mushy fish and mushy tomatoes do not compliment each other.  I was so desperate for some texture I started eating the stale bread again.  My friend had the lamb special and she didn't finish it.  She said it was very gamey.  We passed on dessert because we were tired of shooting looks of disappointment at each other all night.

Food = 1 star ...Go to Cheapeau! instead.
author: Chelsea C.

description: The food and service were good, but the restroom was filthy. I can't believe such a nice restaurant has a unsanitary restroom.
author: Jin Yeong K.

description: Food is good but service has deteriorated to the point where I will not go here anymore.  I was never given a reason why I was waiting for over an hour for a lunch entree and the manager was unapologetic.
author: Andy G.

description: went with boyfriend during SF restaurant week. The restaurant is located in a nice alley, slightly away from the hustle and bustle of SF downtown. The food was really really good -- I loved the French onion soup, and the creme brûlée was amazing. I got the trout dish for the entree, and this was also good, although not as amazing as the appetizer and dessert. The only thing that bothered me was that all the tables were really close to each other -- you can hear the entire conversation going on at the table right next to you, even without trying. But the bf said that's what it's like at most French places, so I guess it's part of the French cuisine experience.
author: Jessie C.

description:
Nice atmosphere, food was not great for the price

Fries over salted
Steak temperature was not cooked right 
Steak sause was over powering
Liver moose was too livery after taste
Pork chops had too much fat on sides
Water bottle $7 each
Onion soup was watery

Bill was $140 with tip

If it was $60 I would give it 5 stars but for this money I give it 3 and would not come here again
author: Igor S.

description:
Delightful restaurant, with pleasant service and good food.  Pomme frites with seasoned dipping sauce were perfect, and a generous portion.  We didn't eat the house bread or butter.  I had my usual salad nicoise, it was overdressed and I thought rather skimpy on the tuna and anchovies.  It was a big plate of lettuce with a few potatoes and capers and a lot of egg and tomato, with very little fish.  I've had better.  My friends really enjoyed their pork dish and steak tartare.  I'd have to eat there again and be more impressed before I would say I'm a fan, but it was certainly good and a much better choice than the nearby chain restaurants.  It's a lovely quiet place for lunch in a nice location.  Lunch for 3 with no drinks was about 60 before tip.


Edited to add another star.  I thought about it, I was too harsh.  I am a fan.  But if my salad is overdressed next time I'm sending it back!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I love the ambiance at Cafe Claude with live jazz playing in the background on Saturday night. The food, wine and service are overall great. We're overall happy with the dishes we had (pate, onion soup, spinach au gratin).

For entrees, my Coq Au Vin was not as good as what I had at other French places. The skin was crispy and the chicken falls off the bone, but I wish there's more sauce (the wine taste is also a bit light). My friend's pork entree has quite strong cinnamon taste. 

Service is impeccable here. Our bread basket is always full. They checked on our water and wine all night. We're so full that night. I wish we had room to try out one of their desserts.
author: Saran R.

description:
Loooved the ambiance here. It is very European, cozy, and quaint. Live jazz music makes it an excellent end-of-the-week spot to relax. Came here to celebrate my francophile friend's birthday. We made our way down the tiny alley and were pleasantly surprised to see a few restaurants with outdoor seating, giving it a very intimate feeling. Cafe Claude is at one end of the alley and is pretty small.

We ended up ordering four different entrees, a dessert, an appetizer, and a carafe of wine. We ordered the gnocchi, seafood en papillote (whitefish baked in paper), duck confit, roasted chicken, and pommes frites. For dessert we had creme brulee and a complimentary chocolate mousse for the bday girl. Wine was chardonnay. Oh we fancy huh?

All of the food was tasty, and you could tell that a lot of effort went into every aspect of the dishes. I think I liked the chicken the best as it was super tender and came in a large portion. The gnocchi was a bit dense and heavy for me. The wine was great as well, although I must say I'm not much of a wine drinker. The jazz music was very enjoyable and the restaurant itself was filled with friendly waiters and patrons alike. All in all our bill came out to about $145 before tipping.

It is a bit on the pricey side, but you're really paying for the experience and ambiance in addition to the food. I would come here sparingly, but only because my wallet can't take the strain. It is a great splurge, though, and I'm glad I got the chance to try it out.
author: Sannie L.

description:
There is Claudine, and then there's Cafe Claude. Make sure you don't wander into Claudine instead meaning to go here (haha..oops!).

Cafe Claude is a dimly lit and vibbin' restaurant with some seats close together (but don't worry, the wait staff is nice enough to move the tables so you can get to your seat so you don't awkwardly bump into the table next to you and knock over their food). The service here was good and their menu reeked of exquisite food and varied meats (fish, steak, chicken, duck) without the astronomical high prices (prices were actually lower than I expected for a nice restaurant)... prices in the low-mid $20's... therefore making it a nice date restaurant. 

I had the fries which were shoestring fries with an almost sweet dipping sauce housed in cute french newspaper-esque wrapping. Yummy.

I also ordered the Confit de canard which is crispy duck leg confit, lentils, frisee, chopped egg ($21). Very good price as the duck meat was warm and tender, the lentils had a nice kick to it and the frisee was good as well. 

Live jazz was playing as well!!
author: Emily C.

description: I have dined at Cafe Claude a half dozen times and loved the food, ambiance and overall experience.  This time, I'm sorry to report, we were disappointed.  There were 5 of us including guests from out of state.  It took at least 15 min for anyone to come and take drink orders and then more than 15 min to receive them.  Salads were skimpy and very disappointing.  None of our meals were anything special and steak could not be cut with steak knife.  We will be hesitant to return.
author: Marcia N.

description:
I'm a fan.  Great French food without the unnecessary bells and whistles, at a good price, with beautiful ambience in the romantic little alley right on the border of the Financial District.  

My favorite thing here is whatever fish they do - especially the trout amandine.  It is done perfectly here, with just enough crunch from the almonds and a light touch of butter without it being too oily.  Very very good fish here - no matter how they do it.  

As for their braised dishes, they are good here but the fish is just better.  

The cheese selection here is also generally very good, so I would take whatever the chef/house recommends.  

Come here for a romantic or casual meal with friends.  It's a festive little alley on Friday nights, and just a short walk to other bars and the Union Square area.  Highly recommended both for convenience, food, and ambience.
author: Mark M.

description:
I normally don't write reviews for establishments with so many reviews, but I absolutely loved this place and had to write one.

Situated in a small alley off of Kearny, it's a bit hard to find, but once you find it - it's a cute, small little restaurant with a nice, romantic, intimate vibe.  

You step inside and there's a bar and small band that plays and the restaurant itself isn't that big.   The walls are adorned with different black and white photographs and the dimmed lighting does add to the romantic atmosphere. 

On to the food: We split the escargot small plate.  They were not in the shell so we didn't have to worry about taking them out.  They were cooked with garlic, butter, parsley, almond, pernod, shallots, anchovy and a puff pastry on top.  This was my first time having escargot and it was ok, consistency is a bit weird for me, but the taste wasn't bad. If anything the ingredients masked the snail taste (if there is even one). For the main course, I had the cod and it was AMAZING.  I'm always afraid to order cod as most times I've had it - it's been too salty. But this was just done right.  Very simple and light, the swiss chard really add a nice taste to the fish.  He ordered the whole trout which was very lemony.  I thought it was delicious, but if you're not a big lemon fan, this may not be the fish for you.  Also, it's the whole fish, so the portion is bigger than the cod I had. Lastly, for dessert, I had the apple tart with caramel, I loved this as well! Not that sweet and light and simple.  He ordered the soft chocolate cake which was simple and good, but I like my dessert best. We shared a carafe of red wine (couldn't tell which as the server had suggested it for us).

Service was ok with staff filling our wine glasses. It was nice having the live music and I appreciated how it didn't get too loud.

Loved this place for the food and ambiance, I would definitely return!
author: Kristine W.

description:
"Snails and raw meat on the sidewalk in an alleyway but ohhhh soo good!"

Atmosphere : We didn't have a reservation so we tried our luck walking in at around 6:30pm.  Luckily we got there early enough we got seated at our own two people table (so we weren't squished with the other customers).  It was nice and heated outside so we had a great time.  They had live jazz music playing half way through our meal which was a really great compliment to our experience.  The waitresses were cute (one had a french accent!) and the service was great, they kept coming back to refill our water and to ask how everything was.

To eat : First we ordered the escargot (5/5) I've never had escargot before -beware its REALLY hot- but it was sooo good! Thoroughly enjoyed it! Then we ordered the steak tartare (5/5) EXCELLENT and the charcuterie sampler with pickles (5/5) really great too!  The coq au vin (5/5) chicken marinated in red wine had really good taste to it, and the Gnocchi (5/5) a must!! was UNBELIEVABLY GOOD. One of the yummiest things I've ever eaten!

Dessert : We ordered the Creme Brulee (5/5) a must!! and the Moelleux Au Chocolat (5/5) -hard to say name for chocolate cake- was very thick with flavor and the Calvados dessert brandy to go with it (a bit strong for my taste but had a hint of apples)

Overall : Great atmosphere, great service, EXCEPTIONAL food and dessert.  So craving it now.
author: Jess J.

description:
I read about live music, but unfortunately we were seated outside and didn't really get to see that side Cafe Claude. I wasn't too fond of the ambiance of outside seating, but inside looked cuter.

A bit on the pricey end but it is french food! I'm not a huge fan of French food but their steak tartare is to die for! and hands down, one of the best escargot around!
author: Yena K.

description:
Took a few people from work to Café Claude, they actually have REAL speaking French waiters/waitress's a bit of a wait however, food was great, service was slow due to busy night.  I will go back again was very happy
Enzo
author: Enzo C.

description:
Definitely tres cool!

Visited SF this weekend for my anniversary and found this fabulous place...quite awesome!

Don't let the alleyway entrance fool you--this place definitely evoked something of Europe. Quite small inside, but they made up for it by adding tables outside in the alley--very reminiscent of other European cities (Barcelone, Roma, Venice, to name a  few). 

They had a jazz trio the night we were there, and we were seated outside--perhaps this was better for us as it might have been a tad loud inside. The outside seating was perfect for us and allowed us to converse in a romantic environment (it being an anniversary dinner after all!). Check the calendar for schedules.

We had the assiette pate and macaroni gratine for starters--both fabulous (I preferred the macaroni just slightly), and then the confit cunard (duck confit) and coq au vin for dinner...both were fabulous as well! We wanted to order the entire dessert menu as everything looked good, but settled for some good old fashioned French dessert: the creme brulee...didn't disappoint either!

I loved everything about this place, and will DEFINITELY be back! It would have been a pure 5-star review for me, except the rest room fell a bit below the standard of the rest of the establishment. It wasn't unclean (though it could have used some upkeep), it just fell short of the standards of the rest of the place...otherwise, it would have been a perfect evening!

But definitely come and enjoy the music, the food, and the fabulous ambience of this place!
author: Joe S.

description:
I've been to this place twice, both for dates. I loved the steak tartar here, especially since they prepare it table side. I remember having the duck for entree and loved it. It was perfectly cooked flavorful. I've also tried their beet salad, which is excellent (although I've never had a beet salad that I didn't like).

I love the intimate atmosphere at the restaurant. The lights are turned low so people all look pretty. Would definitely come back again.
author: Alice W.

description:
After a few drinks at Rickhouse, we were all hungry and stumbled to find a place that could seat us quickly and had good reviews. Luckily, we stumbled upon Cafe Claude and after seeing the reviews, we were told the wait would only be 15 minutes that Tuesday evening. We got another bottle of white wine to share and were seated almost immediately after. The interior of Cafe Claude is very intimate with low candle lighting and would be perfect for a date night. We were probably the rowdiest group there, but the waitress was very patient with us as we got seated and proceeded to ask questions about the menu. 

Since we were all starving, we quickly decided on the steak tartare to share, which was FANTASTIC, at least in my state-of-mind at the time, it was very good. My dinnermates also had the french onion soup that looked piping hot and had a ton of melty cheese on top. Must try that next time!

The entrees were brought out very quickly after and small table became crowded with coq au vin, faux filet and porc. None was THAT memorable, but every dish was good. May need to try Cafe Claude again at another time when we haven't had that many drinks, but all in all, it was a great dining experience.
author: Angela S.

description:
Service,  food,  and wine were good but not great. 

The duck confit was not traditionally prepared and this was obvious by the taste and texture. The brussel sprouts were tasty but made so by the prevalence of bacon. 

Wine by the glass selection was mediocre and overpriced.
author: Kevin V.

description: Lovely space.  They accommodated our pre-play request for quick service and quick cocktails.  Moulles Provencal were fab and wonderful.  Steak Tartare is amazing. Coq au Vin was dry and flavorless, a real sin for this lush dish. Overall good evening with one bad dish.
author: Tomas T.

description:
I get lunch here about once a month or so; it's much nicer than my desk, much better than fast food and totally better than not eating. 
I love their French Onion Soup and their Niqoise salad.
Obviously this place is cool because it's alley way status and I wish to come at night sometime because I guess they have some music now. Also I want to try their dinner.
author: Lizzy M.

description: We were visiting the San Fransisco area for a conference. We went to this restaurant on a Friday night since it was walking distance from our hotel. I had to google the items on the menu because I don't speak French, but the menu is not too long. We sat outside near the heat lamp. The ambience was great. I ordered the steak and fries and it was absolutely delicious!  The drinks were also terrific. For dessert, we had the creme brûlée. It was tiny, not a sharing portion. Overall, I would say the experience was excellent.
author: Michelle M.

description:
Restaurants in alleys scare me only slightly less than restaurants located below-grade.  Sunshine is the most powerful disinfectant. (I think I butchered that saying, but you get the point.)  Rats and garbage cans are commonly found in alleys, not amazing restaurants.  Yes, it's alley location gives Cafe Claude the aura of an "authentic" local restuarant which is SOOO appealing to the many conforming non-conformists infesting San Fran.

But is the food any good, you ask?  Yeah, it's ok.  Pretty standard French fare.  A little on the bland side.  They're not breaking any new culinary ground here with the cuisine.  It's pretty standard everyday French.  Kudos to them for not giving me food poisoning, despite the alley location.

If I was really in the mood for French food of this type, I'd probably head over to Cafe de la Presse instead.
author: Ryan W.

description: This will be blunt but Yes, highly recommend. Outstanding service. Our server's wine recommendations couldn't be more perfect. The escargot has definitely landed a spot in not only a top 10 but I believe my top 3 ever. (I think I'm kind of a snob so I'd say I think it's pretty good. I do hope you agree) in time I hope to write better reviews but if you feel like French food or just hanging out in a hidden gem of an alley with white table cloths and live jazz, by all means, you gotta give this place a try
author: Tozar S.

description:
Great ambiance - perfect place for a date. The outdoor area is cozy. And the live jazz music can be heard from wherever you sit. My hubs and I had dinner here on a rainy Friday night without a reservation and we were seated right away. The service was fantastic.

For food -  a nice selection of wines by the glass, went with the server's recommendation and was very pleased with her selection. For an appetizer we started with the beet dish, which was very tasty and plated beautifully. My hubs ordered the monk fish, which was perfectly prepared. The sauce was out of this world. I ordered the one and only vegetarian dish on the menu, veggie lasagna. It was OK, nothing fancy. It's nice they even have a veggie dish on the menu but I expected it to be a bit more creative. 

If I was a fish or meat eater, I would give this place 4* but as a vegetarian, you are extremely limited and for $20 the veggie lasagna is nothing special. On that note, even though I wasn't blown away by dinner, I  would definitely go back for wine, an appetizer and/or dessert.
author: Betsy R.

description:
Enjoy lunch here about 4 times a year, and always find myself asking why, I do not come more often. The service is awesome, the food is a good as any restaurant in France, and I have traveled throughout France many times.  Entre envy is typical, because every dish is creative, colorful, and thoughtful. Great atmosphere, and they do not rush you. You could sit all day, drinking wine, and feeling like you are in Paris.
Save the trip to France, go to café Claude!!!
author: Karl M.

description:
I came here for dinner on a Thursday night, and the experience left me drunkenly full and craving for more - if only I had enough room in my stomach. 

They had a jazz trio, whose lively performance amplified the dining experience and brought out a touch of San Francisco's overall charm. I can only comment on a sampling of the menu but given that 90% of what I ate was amazing, I'd be willing to bet that the rest of the menu is top notch as well.

Onion soup - cheesy and delightful

Steak tartare - fresh, mouth watering, hands down my favorite dish of the night

Pate de campagne - my palate was not quite amenable to the pate de campagne but my date enjoyed it!

Faux Filet - I've had a lot of steaks. It was in my top 10! I couldn't finish it because the buttons on my jeans were already popping.

Overall - great ambiance, great food, a little packed but I accepted it as part of the experience. I'd go back for more tartare!
author: Jane K.

description: Cold food. Uncomfortable seating. Service mediocre. Don't know how this could have four stars overall??
author: Simon B.

description:
Don't eat here unless you're French. The nice French guests received great service. We did not! 
My food was wrong and my server never came back. Though I watched him check on the French 3 times.
I me never got a second drink even though I finished my first before the food arrived!!!
author: Dee E.

description:
My mom was in the mood for French, and she used Yelp to pick this place. It can be a bit tricky to find, as it's in a side alley, but there are A-signs to demarcate Claude Lane and get you to your food.

We ordered the trout and the coq au vin. Both were lovely, but I wasn't over the moon about them. We also had the creme brulee, which was, in fact, delightful. All in all, I would go again.

The good: tasty French food. Pretty decor inside, but watch out--it's pretty intimate.
The bad: the waitress had some trouble with our check, but fixed it right away.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Cafe Claude is one of my favorite dinner spots in SF. The french onion soup is amazing. My advice is to go for lunch and split two sandwiches with a friend. 

Side story: A few years ago, my boyfriend of the time and I went to Cafe Claude for lunch. When we asked for the bill our waitress told us it had already been taken care of by a gentleman who had already left the restaurant. The kindness of strangers can be so touching. I look forward to the day when I'll pay for the dinner of a young couple.
author: Eliza D.

description:
This place is soo incredibly good. Wish it was less expensive though. There were few vegetarian options, but the ones that were there were really really good.
We had the bisque the mais (basically a sweet corn soup), gnocchi a la parisienne (only vegetarian entree) and the pommes frites! They were all really awesome.. as good as Greens which is my favorite vegetarian gourmet restaurant!
The bread pudding dessert was nothing that great.. will probably skip that the next time around.
author: Aditya M.

description:
My girlfriend was in town and she wanted something French. At first, I was going to suggest something in Belden Alley but then I found great reviews for Cafe Claude so I thought to give this place a try. 

The restaurant is located in a very quaint little alley, right up the block from Belden, which is known for its French establishments. The entrance and outdoor seating area is quite charming and the interior has a very romantic feel to it. We ordered the onion soup and the steak tartare, both of which were amazing. The onion soup has just the right amount of flavoring that I like, not too salty and not too bland. The steak tartare was presented in a beautiful, artistic manner and it tasted even better. Our server also made some great wine recommendations. 

The only drawback was the creme brulee, which was quite ordinary. I expected more from a French restaurant. I'm sure I'll be back again and I'll give another dessert a try.
author: Chi N.

description: Lovely! A terrific jazz combo and terrific food. Who knew sitting outside in an alley could be so much fun?
author: Be F.

description:
S'il vous plaît?

First of all, I loved the search.  It is one of these places I happened to pass by - in an alleyway between streets near downtown.  And I happened to come with a friend who had spent time in Paris.  And the friend noted how it is like a little piece of that magical city.  And I can see it, a hideaway alley adjacent to the restaurant, sitting on the street enjoying wine, waiter speaking to you in French ... weather or not you understand ... and while it wasn't a date for me (just catching up with a friend), I think it would be a great place to bring your special someone for an enchanting evening and be transported to some place a little bit more magical than (ahem) the regular 'ole neighborhood and indulge a bit on frenchy sounding things.  

bon appetit!
author: David K.

description: This is a go to for me. I love the food and the service is great. They play jazz sometimes which is cool. I love the trout dish and the spinach appetizer. Oh and the french onion soup is one of the best I've had. I don't rate this place a 5 because it's a little expensive and the venue isn't particularly cozy or beautiful. When you walk in to get your table you are blocking the waiters from walking around and you feel out of place, there is no real wait area. Other than that it's really yummy and worth making a stop to.
author: parisa e.

description:
I decided to come here for business lunch due to its convenient location near Union Square and the good reviews on Yelp. The moules frites was delicious - frites on top were crisp and fresh and the white wine and parsley sauce was delicious, fragrantly seasoned with garlic and onions. Great for dipping the baguette into the sauce. Salad maison was a nice side accompaniment of butter lettuce, shallots, tarragon and sherry vinaigrette. The Paris Brest dessert was a tasty twist on the classical dish. Instead of hazelnut filling, it was filled with whipped marscapone cheese with lavender scented berry sauce. Waitress was attentive and gave us just the right amount of attention. Love the location in an alleyway - made jt very intimate. Tasty food, good service. The only downside was the overall price tag -
$90 seemed pretty heft for lunch where we ordered no appetizers.
author: Terri S.

description:
Dropped in for a glass of wine and quick snack.  Split the burger, fries and cheese plate.  Not a wide selection of by the glass but a nice variety.

Fries were amazing!  Service was great.
author: Roger S.

description: Of all of the great restaurants to choose from in SF, this is not one of them.   I went with my two sons and expected to have an amazing evening.  We did in spite of the food being cold and the staff being totally disinterested.  Even the hostess was far from welcoming. I had to send my mussels back - they must have just come out of the freezer.   The steak frites was tough and again cold.  My son, who had flown in from NY only ate his because he was hungry and tired from his trip.  He is an avid Open Table user and normally the ratings are spot on.  Not so with Cafe Claude.  If you happen to pass this restaurant in the alley - walk on by you will be happy you did.
author: Elaine C.

description: Great local spot, and amazing creme brûlée :) didn't catch your server/bartenders name but she was very nice as well ! Live music in the corner as well
author: Shawna M.

description:
Cafe Claude has my favorite combination of food and live music in San Francisco.

Their live music is typically local Jazz (or similar) bands every Thursday through Saturday. I highly suggest looking ahead what band is playing each night (you can find each band's music on YouTube) and reserve in advance.

For food, I suggest getting the pâté platter to begin. Most entrées on the menu are pretty good and I personally keep going back to the steak. They also have a good selection of digestives, desserts, and coffee.
author: Quarup B.

description:
What a disappointment!

We ate here for a really brief dinner before we went to a show on Saturday night.
The ambiance and the restaurant itself, the staff were all lovely....however it was the food that let this place down. Our server mentioned that a new chef had just started and thus our server really couldnt recommend too many dishes as he hadnt tried them! To add insult to injury the lamb shanks were not available (even though it was a Saturday daily special) and the French Onion soup we ordered was bland, water and in desperate need of more seasoning. (Cafe Claude...take a leaf out of Absinthe's book on this one)...the coq au vin was underwhelming and an incredibly small portion and my husband's sole was lacking flavor and again was on the small side. I ate here approximately a year ago and had a wonderful experience...so this was really disappointing.
author: Nicole E.

description:
Overall: Amazing a great place for special night out! 

Atmosphere- very classy, low light and romantic. Live jazz band was perfect for the evening.

Plate:  
*Lemon zest Trout- was amazing and very balanced in flavor. 
*gnocchi w/ pumpkin purée. Outstanding a top notch plate. Every bite was heaven! 
*French onion soup, still goes to Mona Mi (Vegas) not as sweet as I like.

This place meets above expectations and well worth the price for a wonderful evening. Even the staff worked with us while running late. 

Will Highly recommend!
author: Nate M.

description: 4 stars is a bit overrated. If this is a four star restaurant you all need to come to Los Angeles and experience a real four star restaurant. We had the chef's special, it was quite a special! Noodle was overcooked, too much olive oil, and no flavor!  I told the manager that I'm no chef but I'll tell you, I cook pasta a lot better than him. He needs to come to my house so I can show him how to cook pasta! Whether or not that message was relayed, I doubt it. My duck was good. The spinach, beef tartar, was good, but the prosciutto pass on. I'm just saying come to Los Angeles to experience a four star restaurant.  Scarpeta, Mastro's, Mr Chow, Providence, Bandera, Grimaldi's, Botegga Louie , there are so many four star restaurant.
author: Randall K.

description: Creme Brule outstanding.  One of our favorites and this one did not dissappoint.  Near perfect!
author: Gary L.

description: I tried very hard to like this place. The staff is great and very attentive, atmosphere is great with their live music, and they have very good selection of wine. The reason for 3 stars is their food. Medicare at best. It's good, but not the best in the city. If you're in for a meal without reservation this may be a place to go. But I personally wouldn't recommend it for the reservation. Maybe it was an off day for them
author: Sam Sooin L.

description: Came in today for a late lunch and sat at a table. The Bartender Horacio waited on us. He was very friendly and knowledgeable. The ambiance in Cafe Claude is very special and has a great vibe. The food was delicious too. Will be coming back soon!!
author: Gonzalo C.

description: Had lunch at Cafe Claude with friends. We ordered drinks and a few shareable plates while enjoying a table out in the alley. The atmosphere is just amazing and the service was impeccable. Can't wait to come back on our next visit to San Francisco.
author: Bill G.

description:
Just had a great night out with the wife.  I've been reading some goods things about cafe Claude, so we decided to give it a try.  We started with the pate appetizer, along with steak tartare.  To my pleasant surprise the steak tartare was prepared table side, and done extremely well.  The portion was generous, and the flavors were well balanced.  I've had steak tartare in a few places in Hawaii, and Colorado.  Cafe Claude is by far the best.  

As for our dinner, the Mrs had the pork chops which was a light dish with huge natural flavors.  The pork chop was the star of this dish, but the supporting cast of; cubed apples, butter beans, cabbage really rounded the flavor palate.  I had the duck confit.  A dish that consisted of the duck, frisée and egg salad, and what I think were black lentils.  The execution of the individual components were well done, but together was confusing.  

The reason for only three stars?  Service.  I've read the service was outstanding at this establishment.  I will have to disagree.  When I failed to receive an order, and decided to cancel it the waiter seemed to challenge me by calling me "boss," and saying "it's up to you" with sarcastic overtones.

I will definitely dine at Cafe Claude again, and will not let someone's bad night ruin an otherwise great dining experience.
author: Trevor A.

description:
IF YOU ARE READING THIS WHILE LOOKING FOR A PLACE TO EAT LAST MINUTE, GO TO GITANE. ITS RIGHT NEXT TO THIS PIECE OF SHIT RESTAURANT. SAVE YOURSELVES! 


Service was sooooooooo horrible. Bad. Bad. Bad. I have no desire to return ever again, especially knowing that Gitane is right next door. I think they have the same owners though? Strange. 

I was shopping in the area with my bf and my cousin. He looked up nearby places and came up with Cafe Claude. We walked a few blocks there and I was surprised to see Gitane on the way since I've always wanted to go (I went the next night). We looked at the menu but we ended up going to Cafe Claude since we already planned on going there. 

No reservations so we waited about 30 minutes while all the employees bumped into us non-stop. The hostess had super delayed response too. She was silent for a good 5 minutes before responding to us when we first got there. 

We got seated right next to another table. They really pack you in like sardines. I asked for water with a straw. Our waiter from hell joked that I couldn't have one but then he really never brought me one. BF asked for water with lemon, never got the lemon. 

Bread was cold and hard. No oil and vinegar here but their butter was tasty. 

We ordered the steak tartare, daily pasta special, and the vegetarian lasagna. The pasta special was sooooo good. Our entire tables favorite. Everything was perfect. I hate ordering pasta at pricey restaurants as I'm sure it cost them all of $1 to make our dish of pasta, mushrooms, onion, butter sauce, and one piece of broccoli. 

I made them use different forks for the steak tartare since we were sharing all our dishes. Our waiter forgot the forks. Idiot. The table next to ours also ordered the steak tartare and it was presented unmixed and nicely presented, much to our disappointment because ours came mixed and entirely over seasoned. 

Vegetarian lasagna was just average. I'm glad they had a vegetarian option though. 

We got the upside down apple tart for dessert that was pretty good. It took us far too long to get the dessert menus and even longer to order because he never came back. It also really irked us that they never cleared our table. What restaurant has servers that don't clear your table before dessert??! 

Live jazz was pretty nice. Service definitely needs to be improved. $60 something dollars for everything.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Nice apps, cute location, friendly staff, and stellar main courses.

Try the coq au vin or the lamb shank. I actually had a stomach ache before going to the restaurant and I forced myself to lap up each bit of juice left in my skillet because it was oh sooo good.

I recommend making reservations days before because they book up fast. :)
author: Heather T.

description: We had such an amazing meal here!! Clara our waitress was absolutely wonderful. Her recommendations suited us perfectly, the music added to our celebratory mood. Wine recommendations provided by head waitstaff were on pat with our order. An overall fantastic experience.
author: Lauren M.

description:
Delicious meal - Cozy Room

I, along with a friend, recently enjoyed a lovely meal at Cafe Claude. As many note, it is a special little hidden spot in a alley (along with Gitane) off of Bush Street.

I had been following and communicating with Cafe Claude for awhile on Twitter. I was very much looking forward to having dinner there. I'd had to cancel a previous reservation and I reached out to apologize.

The food was very good. I really like the coziness of the room. This is definitely a date worthy ambiance. But, I think the best part of the experience was the service. It was tremendous throughout the meal. Our server was friendly and informative.

While I am not going to write up details on each dish. I will state that everything was very well prepared and presented. The chocolate mousse was heavenly.

We tried each others dishes. So, I had a little bit of everything and each dish was enjoyable.

Appetizer:
I had fennel soup.
She had French onion soup.

Main:
I had Coq au vin.
She had Ahi.

Dessert:
We shared the chocolate mousse. Plus, we had complimentary port.

Overall:
Cafe Claude provided an excellent all around dining experience. The experience is a blend of a comfortable room, quality cuisine, and excellent service. I will definitely return.
author: Mark D.

description:
As much as I'd like to think I am pretty up-to-date on what's hot & what's not...I'd say I'm not breaking any ground when I get around to reviewing a spot that already has like 700 reviews.

Despite this, let's just go for it anyways :)

Nestled on tiny Claude Lane right next to Gitane (another cool spot BTW..see earlier review), Cafe Claude offers a very intimate cozy feel.  Lighting at night is dim but warm. Ambiance last night was complemented by the great live jazz band that was playing throughout the meal.  Because the space is pretty small, you definitely will be getting to know the tables right next to you...especially when they have to limbo around you to take a bathroom break.  Better start off with some drinks...thankfully the cocktail list is extensive and they don't mix 'em weak.

Up to bat 1st...Pate Sampler.  They basically have 4 pates and you choose 3.  All of them are tasty, but the Truffle Mousse one is the supastah of the bunch...for sure.

Next up...Entrees.  Last night we sampled the Coq Au Vin and the NY Strip special.  Coq Au Vin was tasty & well-prepared...but not mind blowing.  The NY Strip however took things up a notch.  Cooked perfectly and drizzled with an intense but not overwhelming blue cheese sauce...this dish seriously rocked.  The side of steak fries and sauteed greens was delish as well.

Last to bat...Dessert.  The Tart Tatin is essentially an upside down apple pie.  Apparently this was our waitress' "favorite" dessert.  We must however have totally different tastebuds since this tart was nothing to write home about.

Other than the dessert, the meal at Cafe Claude was really quite nice...like a solid 3.75 stars.  If you're in the Union Square neck of the woods, I'd say you should trek over to Claude Lane and check out Cafe Claude or Gitane...can't really go wrong with either choice.
author: Justin L.

description: In San Francisco for vacations, we went with my fiancé and a friend to have lunch here. Place was clean and cozy and customer aervice was great. For appetizer, we had rhe steak tartare which tasted great especially since I had never attempted to try one. I had the warm goat cheese salad with chicken and it was really delicious. The chicken portion was enough and very tender and juicy. My fiancé had the fish and it was delicate and delicious in flavor. The french fries were to die for! I was really happy and full after we ate!
author: C G.

description:
I have always had absolutely perfect dining experiences at Cafe Claude, with at least 5 wonderful evenings to account for.  My now-husband introduced me to that place in March of 2008 as our first date :), then I came back once with a coworker, once with a group of friends, once with my mum, and finally for lunch with a group of 14 people (friends & family) on the day of our civil marriage ceremony (!) ...  Basically, whatever the occasion is, whoever I am with, I am confident that I will have a good time and even impress my guest(s). 

That makes Cafe Claude one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco, my favorite refined but still affordable French restaurant (I am very French myself) and the #1 place that I want to go to if I am not in the mood for sushi.

About the food. This is your diner recommendation:
To Start: Escargots en Croute. 
For the main course: STEAK TARTARE!!
To Finish: Crème brûlée
I would have happily provided an alternative selection but they have changed the menu again.... grrr, I am averse to change and that means I am no longer expert about Cafe Claude's menu. Plus, I can't get over the fact they don't serve Coquille Saint Jacques or Seared Ahi Tuna any longer (that was in 2008-2010, the sauce that came with it was succulent). But new menu items are keeping it exciting. 

Their steak tartare is fantastic, very colorful and fine in flavors and presentation, served in a professional fashion and with perfectly toasted bread.  I am not expert in steak tartare (which woman wants to be?) but I've had steak tartare in many different locations in the US or in France and this one is easily ranked #1.

The ambiance is warm, romantic and classy. Very enjoyable. If you sit outside, make sure to sit under the heating lamps, they create a comfortable atmosphere. Further away it starts getting dark and chilly. 

I have always received average good service. For the 14-people lunch party on our civil marriage day, Kandis took care of us in a very professional way. It was nice of Cafe Claude to accept our large party in the middle of the afternoon, they don't usually do that but we had special circumstances as, like said above, my husband and I had our first date there ... 

... that's for our love story at and with Cafe Claude :)
author: Annabelle G.

description:
Complex french flavours at paletteable prices. 
There are better places, but there are worse prices. 

The brussel sprouts are awesome. Get those for sure. Steak tartare was interesting too - the waitress made it right in front of us for us to see. 

The bread and butter here is also really good. The butter was fluffier and lighter than any I've ever had anywhere else.
author: Alvin D.

description:
Good dating place, they have a jazz band sometimes.
The food is good.
author: Jean C.

description: Lovely evening with a friend visiting from out of town. Cute alleyway leading to the restaurant puts you in the mood. Inside at the bar, really good music by a three piece jazz ensemble. Sitting outside under the heat lamps the ambiance was lively and really fun. And the food - best I've had this side of Paris. Escargot was amazing.
author: judy h.

description:
Amazing service and ambiance. Cafe Claude is the kind of place where the server will provide excellent service and remember you the next time you visit.  The lovely couple next to us were out-of-towners who come here every time they're in SF and our server recognized them.  She brought them complimentary glasses of bubbly and told them it was great to have them back.  

I love my carbs so.. (this is so embarrassing) I had the pasta dish (okok enough mockery). It was a bit overwhelming which is a big "DUH" since it is a French place but the mussels were pretty good. FYI, it comes with HUGE croutons.  Fries were good. For dessert, we shared the chocolate mousse, which was a bit too sweet. 

In all honesty, 3.5 stars for the food but 5 for the excellent service and atmosphere. 

P.S. Definitely make a reservation before you go. Even if it's for lunch on a weekday, this place gets packed!
author: Cindy K.

description: I had a wonderful meal here. The duck leg confit was excellent. The service was a little awkward, but not horrific. The live music with a jazz singer was a lovely touch, although they were squished in a corner out of view. The layout is a bit cramped, but the food is good.
author: Jacob W.

description:
Where better to shelter on a drizzly winter night than in a tiny French bistro tucked into an alley in downtown San Francisco.

The food is very good, the wine selection adequate and the service is top-notch.

Apparently, they also frequently feature live jazz performances which I was mercifully spared on the evening I went.
author: Rick S.

description:
In an area that tends to lean more masculine and "Banker" than I oftentimes prefer, Cafe Claude is a welcome respite that always leaves me wishing my appetite could double on command. I especially like the cod with cauliflower and raisins (perfect combination of sweet and savory), and highly recommend the cheese board starter.

Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Financial District.
author: Judy L.

description:
Ate here in 2006 (yes, I'm yelping about it 4 years later) and I liked the place. Cafe Claude is super cute! If you do come here, you have to go on a day when they have the live band playing. The live band really kicks up the ambiance a few notches, making the place even more romantic. We had the Coquilles Saint Jacques which comes with
scallops, shrimp, mussels, mushrooms,bread crumbs, gruyere. It as great and the presentation was so adorable (so cute, I took the shell home as a souvenir =D ). I tried the Filey Mignon which was tender and juicy, just the way I like my beef...I also had the Coq Au Vin, which I did not like too much. It was a bit too salty for my liking. 

The best thing here is their dessert! OMG, the chocolate cake is incredibly moist and melts in your mouth!  We came back to this same restaurant 2 years later, and ordered the same exact thing we ordered the first time. It wasn't as memorable as the first time, but it was still good..

Service was great. Waiter had a cute french accent and kept checking up on us.
author: Nancy Y.

description:
The main trout  and the spinach side dish were delicious.  The penne dish was a bit dry and burnt.   

I enjoyed sitting in an alley in San Francisco, but even with the tent and the heaters, it was a bit cool unless you were very warmly dressed or were directly under the overhead heaters.

We had a very friendly waitress.
author: Rob N.

description: Ordered the duck and chocolate cake. The duck was well cooked and had a wonderful flavor. It was balanced with lentils and a nice frisée salad. However, the cake was not very impressive. For 8 dollars a serving, it was not very flavorful and was served in a very small portion.
author: Jasmine C.

description:
Service was good. I love how its in an alley. Went on a Friday night, they have some live music which is always nice. 

Steak tartare was delicious!! French onion soup was meh, but thankfully it came out bubbling. Nothing's worse then lukewarm soup. Mac n cheese was okay, the break crumbs was good. I had the duck with rosemary which i was a fan of. Not too heavy. 
Bread pudding was very good.
author: Glessie C.

description:
Loved everything about it. The music, the wine, the cheese, the entrees. Heaven!

Do make a reservation or sit outside if the weather permits.
author: S S.

description: Great spot for lunch or dinner. Great service and food. My husband and I had a really nice lunch together on a Friday afternoon and enjoyed every minute!
author: Kim P.

description:
Beyond 5 stars. Crazy delicious French food (if there's any type of pork tenderloin special - GET IT) in a cozy, Parisian, jazzy setting tucked away in a hidden little alleyway downtown. Great for lunch and dinner. Romantic, but also not so much that you can't enjoy this meal with friends for any other special occasion. Also, surprisingly affordable.

While it's no secret that the French love and know their food, I've also sadly yet to be really impressed with any that I've been exposed to, here in San Francisco at least. That was until I met eyes with this gem of a restaurant a few years ago.

I normally will talk up a place until I'm blue in the face when I love it enough to give it 5 stars, but Cafe Claude has, time and time again, left me smitten and speechless. 

J'adore.
author: Betty W.

description:
I went with a friend after hearing that it was good, and we were not disappointed. I had the onion soup and the cod. Both were excellent, but more than that, I think that the excellent service and level of personal attention will be my overall lasting impression.
I'll go back for sure !
author: Cliff C.

description:
Cafe Claude presents a really nice atmosphere for dining. It's cozy (but not crowded), they have live music several days a week, and the wait staff are friendly and helpful.

Unfortunately the actual food didn't match the rest of the experience. The dishes were "okay"; nothing was horrible but at the same time nothing was stand out. The food just didn't match my expectations or experiences at other French restaurants.
author: Glen G.

description: The place is romantic but nothing extraordinarily also the food was good except for my meal,I ask for pork chop that was so" hard to cut " I can't eat but the rest was good .
author: Juan M.

description:
I was in SF for one night and wanted to find a Restaurant with good food, good service, & good ambiance. Happy to say- I FOUND IT!!! 

OH, AND THEY HAD A JAZZ BAND. 

Tucked in an alley in downtown SF. Cafe Claude may be one of the best places for dining in SF.  I loved the Brussels Sprouts!
author: Gigi M.

description:
Last week my girlfriend came up to the city to have dinner with me. Originally, I planned to go to Gitane but there was a long wait and we were hungry. We decided to check out Cafe Claude because it had caught our eye on the way to Gitane.

First off, I love Claude Lane - what a cute, romantic little alley way. When we walked into Cafe Claude they were able to seat us right away. I enjoyed the atmosphere and decor - very casual yet classy.

Our server was nice and service was attentive. We had a few cocktails, all of which were great tasting. Food was also great - most dishes we loved, a few were okay. After looking at the menu and wanting to order everything, we decided to order 1 entree and share a couple other appetizers (which they call small plates here).

We shared the Pate De Campagne (pork pate), Coquilles Saint Jacques (scallops), Tartare de thon Rouge (ahi tuna), Pates du Jour (pasta of the day), and their Macaroni and Cheese.

We especially liked the Pate and Pasta of the Day. I'm glad the server suggested the pork pate over the others, since he explained to us that it was the more traditional version and their other options were on the sweeter side. The Pasta of the Day was a Rigatoni with Pork Belly in it - YUM! Excellent, excellent dish. I was a little disappointed in the scallops - the scallops were good, but the dish was mostly sauce and mushrooms. Don't get me wrong, I love saucy mushrooms, but if I'm paying a decent price for scallops, I want more! There was just too little of it. Tuna Tartare was okay and the Macaroni and Cheese was excellent but unfortunately by the time we got to it, we were getting full and the creaminess of it made it difficult to eat.

Overall, great little restaurant. I'm glad we found it and tried it out! Definitely made for a great girlie dinner date.
author: Tiffany K.

description: So I did my reservation two days in advance, I got an email, a text and a voicemail confirming my reservation for 7:30 pm - got to the restaurant and the hostess tells me that they don't have a reservation under my name! They apologize and still gave us a table but we got probably the worst table. The food was just ok; not worth the price - I ordered the duck leg, and it was a little dry, nothing special about it, it tasted like it has been sitting at the kitchen for a while waiting to be served.We won't be coming back.
author: Adriana R.

description:
My hubby wanted to treat me to some French food while we visited the city.  This place had great reviews so he made reservations.  We arrived early, no problem, we were seated in a cozy booth by the window.  Our waiter was great!  We didn't have any knowledge of the wines on the menu since all/most were from France.  We expressed what we were wanting and he was able to meet our taste buds' desires.  We shared a beet salad, Hubby had the duck and I had a cheesy, delicious baked macaroni dish.  The food was rich and tasty (so French) - portions were just right!

I will come back again - FOR SURE.  I will also plan to stay after my meal and enjoy the live music. 

Great service - quality food - great ambiance - live music -
author: Mary G.

description: I ate there yesterday and I like the place in general. The food is good and the service was good but I had two specific problems that bothered me. 1) the escargot, which was great, was missing a pastry covering on the middle snail and thats the best part. 2) I ordered the mussels and while the broth tastes great there wasn't enough of it and the mussels came out cold and since there wasn't a lot of broth I couldn't warm them back up. Also, they serve the french fries on top of the mussels which is completely stupid imho. I wish they would serve the fries on the side. Oh, and the complementary french bread is great.
author: John T.

description: I would give this place a 3.5. The food is decent. My favorites are: escargot pastry and the duck leg. I take away points for service and its lack of consideration for people with children! They did not have even a single high chair or booster seat! What statement are they trying to make ... they don't want kids in the restaurant? Our server wasn't very friendly and was a bit snide when we asked her questions regarding menu items. Smile a little women!!
author: Kamakshi R.

description:
My husband and I had not been on a date night since we had out baby six months ago.  Needless to say a romantic night out was sorely needed. Cafe claude was the perfect place for us to dine after seeing a show. We arrived a little earlier than our reservation but they seated us and let us order drinks before dinner service even began. 

Our waiter was French and greeted us with bon jour!  He was very friendly and prompt. I didn't even notice my drink being refilled 

The food was really yummy! I ordered the onion soup which was so good!  My husband ordered the hangar steak. It was cooked just the way he asked and had a delicious sauce on it. I had coq a Vin which was good but not the best. We ordered a Gratin to share which was amazing!  For dessert creme brûlée and flour less molten chocolate cake. Both were really good. 

Overall this place exceeded mine and my husbands expectations. The food came out quickly and in the proper order (I HATE when soup or salad come out at the same time as the entrees). Portions were larger than I expected.  The food was also fresh and hot. The only negative is that it is a little expensive but I thought it was reasonable for the area and for French food. I would definitely recommend Cafe Claude.
author: Lisa S.

description:
Great place for a sunday night!

Hoever, first, their cocktail might be the main reason I did not give this place a five star.
I ordered the Solace, which is totally a disaster....it's a mix of cucumber vodka, ginger liquor and fresh lime juice, got a really weird bitter and sour flavor. For another drink, Hummingbird, despite its fancy name, its just Mojito without mint leaf. 

The food part was a pleasure experience.
To start, we had Escargots and Charcuterie. the Escargots are great, goes perfect with the puff pastry. 

For entree, we went for Lamb shank and Pan roasted ling cod. The Lamb Shank is a special menu for that day, nicely flavored and well cooked, I would come back for this again. The cod is only ok, good fresh fish but the flavor is too plain. In addition, we got creamy salted spinach as a side and it turned out to be one of the smartest choice! 

To finish, we ordered creme brulee and moelleux au chocolat. The creme brulee definitely made the night, it's just the perfect way a creme brulee should be, crispy at the top, soft and creamy in the center, not too sweet, but makes a great touch. Moelieux au chocolat is a thick soft chocolate cake, i personally feel it too heavy and too sweet.

Overall, I will come back to this place again.
author: Coco S.

description:
I stumbled upon this place completely by accident while waiting for a hair appointment.  I LOVE this little place and everything about it.  The atmosphere is so warm and romantic.  I sat at the bar solo, which is pretty small, and enjoyed a glass of champagne and the Pate tasting platter.  It was really tasty. I am huge fan of french cuisine and cannot wait to go back for dinner or lunch. Everything the waiters brought out for other guests looked amazing!  The staff is super friendly and the bartender chatted with me the whole time, making me feel at ease as a solo diner.
The location is adorable, down a little alley (Claude Lane) off Kearny, just a few blocks from Union Sq.  Cannot say enough good things about this place. A perfect date restaurant or a fun shi-shi lunch with the girls on a shopping day in the city.
author: Leslie M.

description: A great spot for a lunch downtown. This cozy little bistro is tucked away in a narrow alley removed from the hustle and bustle of the area. The outdoor seating reminiscent of European bistros, instantly caught attention. We enjoyed lunch inside. Perhaps I'm impatient, but waiting ten minutes after you've been seated to be greeted by anyone, be it a server or busser is way too long. But this seems to be the trend in San Francisco. While the initial service was slow our server was quick to get our orders in since we were on a time crunch. Items ordered were the steak tartare, chevre salad, onion soup and the Nicoise. The Nicoise was my order- generously topped with tuna confit, green beans, egg, olives, capers, potato and anchovies. It was delicious. It's unclear as to whether the tuna confit is made in-house or if it's canned in olive oil, but either way I enjoyed it. Portions were definitely satisfactory and everyone in our group enjoyed their meals. Prices were a little high for lunch time.  Perhaps it's the location. Everything was truly "a-ok."
author: Isabella J.

description: I obviously haven't been exposed to the full potential of Cafe Claude - usually only coming here for lunch. Came for dinner last week and was super happy with the bistro food they serve. The cocktails were okay. So was the French onion soup. But the steak tartare was great. So was the special of the day - stewed rabbit w/ mustard. The rabbit was lovely and tender - and a healthy serving too (if I wasn't so hungry I could have saved some for lunch).
author: Jean K.

description:
Real nice, authentic French dish. Waitresses are really Friendly and most have French roots!
Serving works also European style, such is a must in this place!
Been for 2 weeks in the US now and this was best meal so far!
Defenitely a must do!
author: Rik P.

description:
We went here to celebrate a Birthday on a Friday night. I made reservations a couple of hours in advance. When we arrived at the time we reserved for, we weren't seated for another 30 minutes (which was fine, since we ordered champagne at the bar). I was hoping  our server would be authentically French with an accent and all, but she was not. She actually wasn't the best server since she seemed to rush us, and wasn't as accomdating as I'd like when we'd ask her to take photos for us. 
We ordered escargot (which was surprisingly amazing for me!), Poki salad (which was delicious as well), and some chicken breast dish along with duck, which were both mediocre. 
THe ambiance was very romantic. The price was surprisingly affordable for this type of restaurant. 
Overall, it was a good experience, but i'm not sure if i'd return.
author: Shirl C.

description: Amazing! Loved the French onion soup. Service was efficient and friendly. Location perfect!
author: Patricia P.

description:
OMG I had no idea. I LOVE steak tartare. Even though I lived in Paris for a year, I could never bring myself to order it. The 1-2 combination punch of raw beef topped with a raw egg yolk was just too intimidating.

So Friday after work I went out for drinks with some co-workers. Lovey Girl met up with me downtown and we went over to Caf Claude. I'd already enjoyed a few margaritas before we got to the restaurant and I was feeling daring. I ordered a Beterave (beet) Salad (delicious) and, of course, the Steak Tartare. They bring it out to you with little dollops of chopped cornichons, capers, echalottes, parsley, and mustard on the side, and of course, topped with an egg yolk in a robin's eggshell. The waitress asks me if I like it spicy and I say pourquoi pas. She expertly mixes up some spicy dijon mustard and olive oil in a bowl, then combines in the steak and all the sides before spooning it back into my plate.

I took my first bite and was totally hooked. It was tender and juicy and delicious. I'm kicking myself for not having tried it before now. I'm usually pretty good about trying new things, but this one took me a while. I have to say, I'm more than happy to finally offer up my tartare virginity to somebody as awesome as Claude. LG even tried some and loved it as well. I've had the pleasure of dining at Cafe Claude at least a dozen times, and I have to say, I'm never disappointed.
author: Aaron M.

description:
Came here for lunch and loved this place!

Food, service and ambiance all great. Seared ahi tuna nicoise salad was good; my colleague got the pork tenderloin dish and said it was delicious.The mac n cheese, fries, flourless chocolate cake and creme brûlée we're awesome - i'd def come back for those alone. Pricey lunch, but overall great experience. Would recommend any day!
author: Erica L.

description: The live music makes this a special date night out place. It is more expensive than some places,nbut less than others. Generally, a lovely atmosphere. The food is quite good. I have also used this location for business dinners as it is easy to carry on conversations and the service is excellent.
author: Ghengis G.

description:
Pros: 
Above the average French food at a very reasonable price. Try their escargots. Romantic and social atmosphere. Great music and crowd. You can come here w/ a small group of friends and have a fun French night or bring your date and be cute. Service is fabulous; waiters are very knowledgeable on both wine & food pairing, and 'on' with the diners' needs. 

Con/be aware of:
Make a reservation ahead of time, especially on weekends. The place can get pretty packed but it deserves it.
author: Tae K.

description:
Cafe Claude features simple French cafe food. To that effect, it's menu is ridiculously predictable from its moules to its steak frites to its coq au vin (might I mention that this is a large chunk of its small menu). 

What I object to is the pricing. At $$$ you need to seriously make that coq au vin unbeatable or make it unique. But with Cafe Claude you get neither. 

And there are so many other amazing French or Cali French restaurants in SF!! Ones that are cheaper too! 

The only thrill you get from Cafe Claude is the cool -- and very small -- building with its bright red awning and its jazz music. The staff is inattentive and poorly managed. The food... Overpriced.
author: Emily M.

description:
I had the pork loin, it was perfect. Tender, juicy, with a flavorful sauce. The only better pork loin I've had was in some restaurant in Prague.
Waitress was super friendly and attentive.
I haven't tried any of the other dishes yet, but based on just the pork and service, 4 stars.
author: Hamid M.

description: Great place to dine if you are in downtown area.  The  green beans, spinach, the steak and frites are all excellent.  Make reservations ahead and you will be pleased with the food and service.  The location reminded us of New Orleans narrow streets.  Wine list is excellent and they have very good desserts.
author: Cordero F.

description:
Found this place by accident while looking for a place to eat with friends.  Hostess was very accommodating, we wanted to sit inside but there didn't seem to be any tables, but she somehow managed to get a table for us.
Food presentation was very pretty.  I had the coq au vin, and while the chicken was very tender, the sauce made it overly salty.  It made me wish I had something else to soak up the sauce.  We also had pomme frites on the side, and they were tasty.
Overall, food quality isn't bad.  However, this place is a bit too dark and crowded to eat comfortably.  This should be more of a 3.5 stars.
author: Karen L.

description:
My Wife and I had dinner last Wednesday nt before a show in the Nob Hill area.
After reading a few reviews , I decided on Café Claude and made reservations. I would rarely give 5 out of 5 stars but we were so happy with the dining experience, I felt it justified. The atmosphere, food, timing, and service were all fantastic and an excellent value! Other reviews that I read commented on a little bit of "attitude" from the wait staff but hey, this IS a French restaurant. Our experience however was quite the contrary. Clara, our waitress, was very knowledgeable and professional. Her timing was perfect and she was attentive without making you feel rushed. 
My wife just pointed out that she was a "good listener" too.

We highly recommend Café Claude to anyone!

Mike and Jennifer
author: Mike W.

description:
Amazing. 

My best friend and I came here on a whim and ended up ordering many of the drinks and dishes - it was definitely a night where I ate waaaay more than I should've but the food was amazing and I couldn't stop! 

First taste of the night: pâté de campagne. My first pâté experience and it was DELICIOUS! I can't wait to have pâté again! 

Next: coquilles saint jacques (bay scallops, oyster mushroom, sauce mornay, parmesan)  and  tartare de thon rouge (ahi tuna, pluot, serrano chili, quail egg, buckwheat tuile). Both exceptionally delicious. 

Followed by: pasta of the day (I can't remember what it was exactly but I remember finishing it all, something that involved pork so of course it was great)  and macaroni and cheese. The mac and cheese was soooo good but a little rich - we couldn't finish the dish between the two of us (I think that was the first time that happened) so we took the rest to go. 

In addition to the food, the cocktails were wonderful. My favorite was the Egalite (jean marc xo vodka, lillet blanc, st germain elderflow- er liqueur and fresh lemon juice).

Overall it was a super cute yet chic restaurant tucked away in an alley. A place I was so happy to find (well, my friend found it) and I can't wait to visit again.
author: Laura W.

description:
I wanted to go somewhere nice for lunch before power shopping in SF. Through my iPhone yelp app, I found this place and made a reservation. 

I had high expectations but was a little disappointed since I think I ordered the wrong sandwich. The French onion soup was okay, I thought it was too cheesey. I had the fancy ham and cheese sandwich (Croque Monsieur), and it was too cheesey again. The french fries were the highlight of the meal. My dining partners had the mussels and scallops, and they both raved about their selection. 

I will come back again for dinner and will order something other than the sandwich.
author: Leddee H.

description:
The food was great and the waiter was very prompt. They get very busy on a Friday night so it is advised to make a reservation. 

What we had (we enjoyed it all):
+ Soupe A Loignon
+ Coq Au Vin
+ Lotte De Mer

4.5 stars
author: Captain B.

description:
This place reminds me of some of the cafes that my husband and I have been to in Europe a little. One of those reasons is because it's located in a little alley and the place has a nice, casual, and classy vibe to the whole place. I came here with a friend not to long ago and I had the french onion soup to start out with. It was good but a little to salty for my taste. For the entree, I had the trout. The cocktails were strong which was good-:) We were there in the late afternoon so it wasn't that crowded then which was perfect.

Our waiter, Enrique was attentive and had a nice accent. Also, he looked like an Italian male model. It's rare for me to think of anyone being above average in the looks department who isn't famous, lol. So for me to remember what his name was after a month or so says something, lol! This place is a little on the pricey side but the food isn't bad. The next time we come back here, I hope to see Enrique once again.
author: Butterfly A.

description:
Food was good but nothing exceptional.
Restaurant was noisy and tables were on top of each other.n So it is awkward if you want to have a personal conversation.
I was trying to catch up with an old college friend visiting from out of town and the next table was a husband and wife that didn't talk to each other and listened in to our conversation. Hope they thought we were entertaining.
Service was exceptional.
This place is average but convenient.
author: Libby M.

description:
Located in the French quarter, on Claude Lane (!), Café Claude is a nice place, close to Union Square. My experience wasn't outstanding, but I found it still a good place for a nice dinner with friends.

The steak tartare was good and well prepared, though it could have been bigger.
The potato gratin with cauliflower cream was good and original.
The pate was very good, and they use real Dijon mustard.

I also liked the chocolate cake, very creamy in the middle, as well as the apple tart.

Overall, pretty good food, though quantities are a bit on the low side and price a bit on the high side. i may go back.
author: Bruno P.

description: Really dont understand what all the hype is.....food below average.  Very load.  Rude service.  Seriously not worth the time nor money.  In SF we have TONS of amazing spots, and this is not one of them!!!
author: Bella K.

description:
Great location. You'll find this cute, quaint restaurant in an alley way in downtown. It's tucked away with strung up lights. Make sure to make a reservation! Even though I made one, I had to wait about 15 minutes but the hostess apologized and the server did give us a free dessert! 

The food is absolutely worth it. Authentic fresh French food. I had the Salmon entree which was super yummy. Service was impeccable and there was live jazz music the night I was there. It's a super romantic candlelit spot.
author: R. K.

description:
So glad to finally have tried this place out. The ambience definitely takes you away a bit from the usual Union Square chaos. Great spot! 

Food and service were right on spot. The Pumpkin gnocchi was AMAZING! Best one I've ever tried hands down. Go with time and truly enjoy your experience. 

Will definitely going back soon!
author: Tathi P.

description: This was my third time at Cafe Claude. The first two times were amazing, but tonight  was a really disappointing experience. I ordered steak medium. The first time it came out it was really rare, so I sent back. The second time the general manager brought it out apologizing profusely, and it was still rate. I sent it back again, and it was still rare.   I mean, what kind of a restaurant doesn't Know how to cook a steak? I don't know what the issue was, but it was so disappointing. I feel like I didn't even have a full meal. They comped my entire meal, but it didn't take away from the fact that the whole experience sucked. I don't know what happened in the two years since I was there last, but I'm not going back again,
author: Dasha C.

description: Great atmosphere -- feels special but not pretentious. I shared the pappardelle and the coq au vin with my friend, and had asparagus and escargot as starters. Enjoyed everything. Would go there again for a cute evening!
author: Jenny S.

description:
