I have probably dined here a hundred times (no kidding) in the past 5 years, and I really don't see any reason to eat anywhere else downtown.  Seriously, you'll pay a lot more at the "other" French restaurant up the street, and you won't get nearly the quality of food or service.  Skip Belden Alley, too.

I've had everything from an $8 lunch (with fantastic daily soups and fresh bread from Acme, why get fast food?), to a full dinner with cocktails, wine, coffee, and desserts (try the chocolate mousse).  Other standouts include the steak tartare (which I wouldn't dare to eat most places) made fresh tableside, the seared Ahi tuna Nicoise salad (which surpasses anything you'll find in France), and any of the special pastas at lunch.

The wine list is a little pricey (two glasses of $15 Chardonnay will cost more than your meal) but well selected.  Live music on weekends (starting on Thursday) is high quality, if a little loud.  Ask for a seat outside under the heat lamps if you want a little more quiet.  And reservations are suggested, especially if you're squeezing in a meal during your lunch hour.
author: Sven E.

description:
So good! At the time we went, they had this AMAZING truffle mac & cheese side dish. My friend got it as her meal, and I was a bit jealous. They have nice mixed drinks, as well. Nice ambiance and friendly staff. This place is hidden in an alley, so I am glad we stumbled upon it!

UPDATE: I took my mom here for a second visit, and it was great again! I especially LOVED the drink I ordered from their special cocktails menu! (They change the drinks regularly.)
author: Kristen C.

description: Café Claude is great: it is cozy, has really yummy food, and the service is good. I've come here many times and have never left disappointed!
author: Rodrigo B.

description: Live Music was way too loud for such a tiny place. The food is superb. Best coque au vin I've ever had. Beatiful tape and apps like escargot. The food here is done right. The waiter was overboard on the wine descriptions and more of a food snob than a great waiter. All in all a great place for a true French dining experience.
author: Jill R.

description:
Wasn't a big fan of the Coq Au Vin, but the flat iron steak was pretty good.
The star of the show was the steak tartare.  In my opinion this is a must try at Cafe Claude.  I've only had this dish a few times but this was definitely the best I've had.
I'd consider stopping by for this dish alone.

The live music was great (Lori Carsillo was performing when I went), ambiance was nice and the staff was attentive.
author: Eroc V.

description:
ooo la la!  I didn't know how much I loved French Cuisine until eating at this magnificent restaurant.  

After visiting the de Young "Birth of Impressionism" exhibit, we decided to keep with the running theme and eat here for dinner.  We had a 7:30 reservation but we were able to change it to 6:30 on a Saturday night.  Thanks for being so accommodating Miss Hostess lady :)

Appetizer included steamed mussels in a DELICIOUS cream sauce, with crunchy fries.  So. effing. tasty.  I ordered the ahi for my entree and had it cooked medium rare.  The sauce was sweet (from the caramelized onions), lightly peppered, and a little salty from the cooked onions and bacon.  I washed it all down with a glass of Pinot Noir red wine.

For dessert I had to get my crème brulée, with a café crème.  Excellent, but unfortunately as a non-coffee drinker I ended up staying awake until the wee hours of the morn, lol!  So be forewarned the coffee is pretty strong!

Would love to go back here again.  The service was quick, the waiter knowledgeable without being too disturbing.  Loved it!
author: Kassandra P.

description:
I had lunch at Cafe Claude and sat inside (I was too cold, it's that darned cold winter in August!) - maybe I'd throw in the fourth star if I had taken advantage of the outdoor seating.

The pasta I had was absolutely great - It was some form of meat sauce pasta - sounds plain but was delicious.  The sandwiches were also great (I'm not a huge sandwich person) and tasty.  Fries left something to be desired, but they're not French are they?

Service was ok - I wouldn't go back for service.  But it is a neat place with pieces of France in it.  Neat atmosphere!

My biggest issue: The lemonade tasted like the lemons revolted on the sugar and they went to battle and the sugar lost.  It was like squeezed lemons and ice.  Maybe I'm unsophisticated, but the lemonade made the chest hair I don't have stand up!  Just be careful when ordering lemonade here...

I'd consider going back, but it is pricey for what you get...Worth trying out, but make sure your wallet is dancing full.
author: Traci H.

description:
I got trout that was okay. I had an awesome trout before so maybe that explained the Cafe Claude's trout was flavorless compared to the one I had. But what disappoint me was that I asked my server first before I decided on my food. I should have been saved from a bad dining experience!

My server said he really likes the trout. And say if it is true, then:
One, he really likes the trout and he thinks it's good.
Two, he really likes the trout and he doesn't have a good taste.

And say if the statement was false, then:
Hm... maybe he only looked at the price of the food? Because trout was the most expensive entree compared to other things that I was interested in.
Or two, my choices were all bad.

Either one, the trout wasn't very good. I got a dessert wine at the end and that save this place from a bad review. I tried a similar wine a year before in France, ordered it but it never arrived. I craved for the wine so bad and was super happy to find it at Cafe Claude. Maybe next time I'll go with the wine and some desserts.
author: Cliff T.

description:
I'm French and therefore partial to any restaurant that serves a decent selection of pâtés and rillettes. Not only are these available at Café Claude, it also offers "small" dishes for European (read "reasonable") portions, lovely desserts, cheeses, a solid wine selection, and good bread. 

The food is fresh, very tasty, the location is pleasant and they have live music. A great place for any occasion.
author: Anna R.

description:
Went here last night for a late dinner. SOOO GOOD. The pate plate was incredible (comes with 3 different types). French onion soup was mouth watering. AND They make the steak tartare right in front of you, and spice it to your liking.... yummm....

Everything was great! And the location was sooooo CUTE - GREAT date spot :-) 

I will definitely be going back.
author: Alison M.

description: Nice vibe, little pricey with smallish portions. Got the short rib special which ended up filling me up, so overall pretty good spot. They are expanding the venue with a live sound stage and extra seating in the next month or so.
author: David W.

description: Great restaurant and music venue. Food and service were top notch, classy but not pretentious, music was great, and genuine French staff (at least our waitress). Highly recommended.
author: Yannick L.

description: Très typique bistro, nice brandade, tasty lamb shank, decent apple tarte, good wine list, cute place, good service.
author: Charles S.

description:
This is more of a story than a review.

My friends and I ate here on a rainy Friday.  We had reservations at 6, but because of the rain and traffic on 101, we got there at 7.  They were really kind about serving us outside, and I think it was better out there.  This place is pretty popular (they make reservations in two hour intervals as in you can only stay and enjoy for two hours before the next party needs your spot) so it was packed with people at every table.  We sat outside with umbrellas and a canopy protecting us from the mist/rain and a heater beaming down on us.  The whole setting was romantic because everything was beginning to get dim, and by the time we got there and got seated, the jazz band started to play.

I'm not a French food connoisseur, but definitely hope to be one day, but Cafe Claude has definitely expanded my fondness over French cuisine.  I recommend the iron steak and the pork filet.  My friend ordered the stead it was succulent.  It was so tender and juicy.  I got the pork filet and, I'm not usually a pork fan, but having a bite of the pork and apple and caramel/honey sauce was really really good.  I believe I should order pork more often.  The service was very attentive and extremely cordial.  I had Hemingway's death in the afternoon cocktail special and soon found out that I don't like it.  The substituted it with the cabernet sauvignon and was extremely happy with the flavor mix with the pork.

While I was enjoying my food, chatting with my friends, and listening to the band, I took a glance at our location.  It's typically a Parisian alley where there's pretty much a road for one car to get through, but instead of a road, it's restaurant patios.  There was a street light that glowed a golden orange from above, people walking by, keeping snug and under umbrellas, next to the stone building right next to our spot, and thought, this somewhat feels like a French restaurant in France with a bunch of American tourist.

My dinner with my friends was terrific.  Thank you Cafe Claude!
author: Kristin O.

description: Great French dishes; we came here for a lunch which was reasonably priced. The location, inside an ally, adds a great touch to the atmosphere. I had the apple braised pork, which came out a bit dry, but the other dishes--fish and pasta--were delicious, based on my little sample. Good menu selection of sandwiches for lunch, although I would argue a grilled cheese sandwich with an egg on top is a bit overpriced at $12.  I'd recommend a 1-time try, but if you ask if I'd come back, I wouldn't.
author: Eddie L.

description:
Service - 5 stars
Food - 1 star
Average - 3 stars

For good French food - go elsewhere.  My favorite is Le Chapeau on Clement.
author: Private C.

description: Nice music with dinner is always a plus for me.  The food were great and the place was hopping even though it is in a small alley between the financial district and Union Square.  There were a few other places in this alley but this place was the only one that was packed the night after Christmas!  Love the way they prepare the steak tartar right in front of you base on your taste.  The escargot with a pastry top was a nice touch.
author: Angie K.

description: We just returned from our day trip to SF,  we had a great lunch at Cafe Claude.  We were there celebrating my Aunt's 80th Birthday.The food was awesome, and the staff was GREAT!    We had a French Waiter, Vincent, and he was so nice and even posed for a picture with us at the end.  Thanks Vincent and the whole staff , we had a great time!  We will definitely recommend Cafe Claude and be back ourselves!!
author: Elise S.

description: Loved the atmosphere. The jazz was fantastic and the ambiance felt like something straight out of Paris. The food was delicious (coq au vin was the most tender meat I've ever had!). Highly recommend for a romantic special occasion. Only drawback was that it took us 20 minutes to get seated despite having a reservation for over a week. Walk-ins got a seat before us...and we were on time for the reservation! They apologized a lot and we forgot about it by the time the wine arrived.
author: Kathleen P.

description:
Came here right after work to take out my sister for her birthday.  We sat outside as it was a nice day.  Drinks were good except I was too late for the happy hour.  I tried everyone's food on the table and most of them was from the specials, delicious!  This is my first time to go to a French restaurant so maybe I should have tried something more French-y? hahah.  
Didn't get to see the place inside so can't rate that.  Our waitress was somewhat nice, but I sensed some attitude.  
I'll come back here again to give this another chance.
author: Claire J.

description:
Ooh, reminded me a bit of France!  You know a place is legit when there are customers inside speaking the native language..!

Ambiance: romantic but casual, not pretentious, and infinitely better when the live music was playing, especially the jazz singer!

Appetizer: French onion soup, soupe du jour (for some reason I can't remember exactly what it was, but it had truffle in it..!), and beef tartare - everything in this category was super well done, and VERY YUMMY, five stars all around..!  Make sure the waiter / waitress mixes the tartare for you, it's suuuuuper delicious..!

Entrees: trout and coq au vin - very yummy but this is where they lose a star.  These were definitely tasty, but not on par with the appetizers.  I think the dishes were slightly overpowered by the sauces / seasonings.

Dessert: tarte tatin - YUM.  Light and tasty and not too sweet..!

Service: fairly decent, although it took our waiter awhile to get a single glass of wine... not the best ever but got the job done.

Don't think you can go wrong if you decide to check this place out..!
author: Cynthia G.

description:
ate here with the gf on a sunday night, and really enjoyed it

pros: 
- our waiter was an obvious pro at what he did, very knowledgable and courteous even when we were the last ones in the restaurant
- food was on point, i had the steak and fries, or shall i call it.. frites. cooked it to perfection
- ambience was decent
- price was good for what we had

cons:
- restroom is killing the vibe of the restaurant
- paper table cloths.. i have actually worked at a (fine dining) restaurant that used paper table cloths as well and despised it..
- somewhat hard to find

i would def recommend this place
author: Tyson T.

description: Steak was cooked to pink perfection.  But what was really great was the steak sauce which I used to dip the frittes with.  The confit canard was always very good, tender interior with crunchy exterior.  Service was also prompt and friendly.  Nice jazz band was playing throughout dinner.  The only complaint was it was a tad cold since front door was left open and everytime back door was opened, a cold breeze went thru the restaurant.
author: T. C.

description: Dreamy spot down an alley, feels like a sweet Parisian restaurant, food was delicious!  Enjoyed the cheese plate and great wine selections.
author: Mary M.

description:
I think my expectations were a little too high for this place based on my friends' reviews.

Made a reservation for a Wednesday night and it wasn't busy at all.  The restaraunt is a bit hard to find.  It's in the alley way next to Lohemans.

Ordered the Pate Campagne for my appetizer.  It was really good! I ate about 3/4 of it myself.  Portion is a bit large for 1 person so it's good to share this plate.  The Pate has A LOT of black pepper (a huge plus for this pepper lover).

Next I had the pan seared trout which was also very good. I could really taste the butter and lemon dressing. The sliced almonds added a very nice crunch to the fish.  I thought the fish was cooked perfectly.  Portion was decent, if i didn't eat so much pate & bread I would have been able to finish my main course.

Hubby had their special flank steak but wasn't impressed.  He thought the carmelized onions made the sauce too sweet.

Unfortunately I did not like the glass of Bordeaux I selected.  However, the Vanilla bean creme brulee was excellent.

One annoying thing is that there are little fruit flies flying around.  I spent most of our dinner swatting around my plate and glass.
author: Terry D.

description: I cant believe this place got such good reviews! The food was sub-par, and the service was TERRIBLE! Not only did we wait for 20 minutes (even though we had a reservation) to get seated, but everyone around our table was complaining about something or another. They brought us the wrong things twice. They never came back to refill our water. The food was way over priced for what we got. I will not be back here again. We thought it would be awesome since it got such great reviews and has a jazz band... but the band wasn't even playing when we were there.
author: Briana V.

description:
After writing my first review, the manager of Cafe Claude sent me an sincere apology, along with an invitation and gift card to try them again.  I couldn't decline their invitation.

We went on a random Saturday at 2:30PM, albeit an odd time to go but nonetheless it made the experience much more enjoyable.  There was only one other group in while we were there and the place was not busy at all.  It was quiet, relaxing, just the right mood.  Regarding noise - I'm a fan of jazz music, but the previous night we went the noise was a little out of control (people).

Our waiter was perfectly attentive (as he should be as there was no one else to serve).  The waiter was friendly, cheerful, and provided excellent service.  We had items from the lunch menu this time and we were so stuffed.

The boyfriend got the Pâte plate and chose the chicken, duck, and goose.  My personal favorite is still the chicken pâte.  The duck was a little weird tasting, but of course he ate it all.  I had the Croque Monsieur and it was the best French sandwich I've ever had.  We also had the Coquilles Saint Jacques and the shrimp and scallops were so delicious!!

I'm not sure if I'd return for dinner at Cafe Claude because it seems to be too congested and more like a party scene than a romantic restaurant.   Plus it's kind of pricey for the food they prepare.  I am sticking with my old review as too salty for dinner.  But I will definitely return for lunch (pâte, Croque Monsieur, and Coquilles Saint Jacques).  I can't pass it up!  Those dishes are reasonably priced and delicious.

Thank you Cafe Claude for extending your invitation to try the restaurant again.
author: Dee H.

description:
To be honest, I'm not the biggest fan of French food. I love the idea/description of it and the names of the food make my mouth water, but when i actually eat the food, it never lives up to the hype. 
BUT, here at Cafe Claude, the food was AMAZING and ended my doubt in the amazingness that is french cuisine. 

I came here on a Friday evening and it was very busy! It had live music and the bar was all full as well. Nice atmosphere, and I especially liked how it was in a quaint little alleyway. It can get quite loud inside, but I think it just adds to the atmosphere! Its also a plus that its downtown, because you can enjoy a happy hour somewhere in the fidi and then catch a late dinner here without having to drive ;) 

As a group of 4, we ordered the following and shared it all: 
- Truffle Mousse pate - love pate. =) ... but don't really know how to judge it. This chicken pate was really tasty though 
- Steak Tartare - Had the waitress mix it up for us. I liked the mustard-y taste of the dish. 
- Lasagne - french style lasagne - it is vegetarian w/ eggplant, zucchini, spinach, tomato. Really flavorful (esp for a vegetarian dish!) 
- Gratin - very well prepared potatoes. yum.
- Porc au Miel - pork dish served with carmelized apples. OMG the apples and the pork went sooooo well together. I loved the tartness of the dish. 

Definitely want to come back to try more from the menu!
author: Tim B.

description:
Romantic ambiance
Great service
Delicious French food

A perfect place for a date.
author: May J.

description:
Delicious French food. The restaurant is nice and the service is always solid. I especially enjoy the creme brûlée, pâté trio, pork with crab apples and brussell sprouts, and the ahi tuna. 
I would come here more often if it was easier to find. I can never find the evasive alley that is Claude Lane.
author: Ravi K.

description: Excellent service and wonderful food if your looking to spend a little bit of dough. Enough said.
author: J. G.

description:
C'est magnifique, vraiment.  Delicious and quite authentically French.
I tried the Croque Madame, which most restaurants in this country just don't do well, and it was like being transported to Place Victor Hugo in Paris. Also, the French fries are done the French way--thin and really crisp (twice fried). The ambiance is quite Parisian and we even had a French-speaking server. A good meal and a lovely experience. I will definitely plan to return. Toute suite.
author: Joanna S.

description:
I love this place for the ambiance, the food, and contrary to the other reviews I've read, the service.  This restaurant is such a great little place tucked into a quintessential Financial District alley that I almost didn't review it, for fear of adding to it's discovery; however it deserves to be frequented.  

Since I work in the FiDi I've only been here for lunch, but a few of my faves are the potato and leek soup, the french onion soup (as good as it gets) and duck...anything.  

It gets pretty packed during the lunch rush so make sure to get a resi and when you get sick of this place and need a change, Gitane is just next door and equally as tasty.
author: Ted T.

description: The best restaurant I've probably been to. Came here on a visit with my fiance and a couple from Hawaii and just had a blast. Amazing live jazz music, perfect ambiance, great wine selection and perfectly portioned plates. We had a cheese/nut appetizer plate with honey that was just spectacular. Will be back for sure!
author: Denis G.

description:
We went to this restaurant on the great reviews it received. It was very intimate and romantic. I loved the live jazz. We had excellent service and we loved all the food except the steak which was tough and undercooked. We asked for medium rare and it was rare. I do like rare meat so I decided not to send it back, but I wish that I had. It was a chore to get through it. It had a lot of connective tissue which you do not expect in a filet.
Other than that though I would go here again.
author: D D.

description:
I was taken out for lunch on my birthday, and we had a nice time. 

Highlights: french onion soup, all of the sandwiches, and my delicious sea bass on quinoa. I wasn't a huge fan of the red wine reduction, but the dish had a nice flavor.
author: Andrea B.

description:
Hmmm. I WILL NOT come back here.  We ended up leaving and finishing up our evening with desserts at Kuletos. 

The GOOD:
-Cute little place (the outside patio reminded us of Paris)
-Cozy atmosphere
-Nice house Bordeaux

The BAD:
-food is OK. Not bad, but nothing that stands out
-in the onion soup a lot of "bowl" is taken by the bread under the cheese.
-jazz singer and band location is odd - the ONLY people who can see the performance are people at the bar. There are maybe only 5-7 bar seating there.
-slow service, unfriendly service, off the wall weird service
-not worth the price

We had planned a trip to SF with a friend for some time now. We did our research here on yelp and picked this placed based on the great reviews. We had a great day prior to coming here: relaxed at our lovely hotel on Union Square, then went for a walk, visited Neiman Marcus for high tea and got our make up done  there as well, bought out new outfits and headed out for dinner and  jazz. We love jazz!

We arrived about 5 minutes early for our reservation. We got seated promptly. The place looked cozy and not yet filled in with people. Our server came by a few minutes later. It took a few minuted to read the menu. The drink menu was not too exciting and I could not see what I can actually order from there, so we decided to order salad and soup at least  since we already took a few minuted to read the menus. The server came by the second time to ask what we want to order for the main course. We each ordered a dish, but then (I saw another server holding a huge salad "por moi") I asked if we can please just have one chicken dish because I really wanted to save room for desserts later.
 While looking at the menus at the beginning I felt very rushed and embarrassed. The server never smiled or even introduced himself and just looked plain bothered to talk to us. Meanwhile we are sitting there like two polite Californians  (idiots, we should have complained) and smiled back with every question or reply. For my drink I ended up getting just a lemon drop for the lack of other interesting choices and felling of being rushed. When my salad arrived with a side of goat cheese covered toast, I thought that glass of red wine would actually go wonderfully with it, so I also asked our server for a glass of Bordeaux. .....hmm 5 minutes later I am still guarding my salad and goat cheese toast for the arrival of the wine..... another 5 min later a manger comes by and somehow misunderstands that I am waiting for a glass of wine and brings a glass of water instead...ok, I can see the confusion: I already have a lemon drop in front of me, it is a bit loud and hard to hear, but I also have a glass of water TOO! Besides, it is very simple to just repeat the guest's request back so there is no miscommunication. Whatever! The manager realizes that there has been a little mistake and promised so come back with a glass of wine.....  My poor salad is getting tired!... hmm  another 5 minutes passes ...a hostess brings my wine. All the while our server is passing back and forth by our table without a worry in his face, probably because he is not even looking our way... FINALLY I enjoy my goat cheese and wine! Needless to say that the main dish arrived before I can finish my salad. The server literally just puts it in front of my friend and walks away. She catches him before he leaves and asks for a share plate (although we did say that we want to share). If you are constant restaurant goer, enjoy good food and appreciate and respect a good service ...you probably don't need to read beyond this point. "Nuff said!

He brings the share plate with such a face that I just want to say "I am sorry" right away... not sure for what, but...maybe it was my hair, or my friend's hair... don't know. At least it seemed that other guest's hairdo were somewhat approved by our server (we did see him smiling! Aha!). My lovely dear friend who is so quiet, sweet and polite, and always smiling - she says to me "I am sorry, I feel like maybe we did or said something wrong?" Besides of my turmoil building inside, we really didn't feed into the bad mood - we were just happy to get together and enjoy our evening. The chicken dish was ok, When the plate was cleared the server comes back and  drops the check on our table "Thanks." 
...................................................................ok.....I clearly remember saying that we were saving room for dessert. It is still at least an hour before closing... WHAT IS YOUR DEAL ,"DONKEY HOLE"? Oh, yes, of course we would like some coffee, thanks for NOT asking. REALLY? Management told you that you should not ask your guests if they want some desserts of coffee? REALLY? REALLY?

Right there I pulled my phone out, called the KULETOS restaurant to see what time they close and if we could come in for dessert. 

You know guys, I usually can't leave a place without leaving 20% tip ...I REGRET that I left 10. KULETOS was absolutely lovely!
author: Anastasia B.

description: Amazing food and atmosphere.  Took my wife for our anniversary and it was amazing.  Amazing service and even better food.
author: Jeremy W.

description: FOOD mmmmmmmm... need I say more?!?!?
author: Catherine N.

description:
Never had a bad meal at Cafe Claude, it's not spectacular food, but it's very good food. I love pates and their trio of pate always satisfies this craving.

I have always thought the atmosphere is cozy, but my husband doesn't like it as much, he describes it as a bit of a "dark hole".

Service has never been a problem, we've always been attended to promptly and servers have been friendly.

Would I go back? Definitely, yes.
author: Sue T.

description:
A group of us came here and I thought it was a nice hidden gem. Nice location and great atmosphere.

I didn't have anything to eat but had a bottle of wine. I want to come here next time to try the food!!! :)
author: Eric A.

description:
My wife and I dined here last night. Great little street with couple of restaurants and pub - very European-esque. Ambiance was nice, a bit noisy but not outrageous. Price was about average - something like $20-25/entre. 

I had the coq a vin and my wife had salmon. Food was decent but only thing French about was the names. My coq a vin which I have cooked often (Julia Child's recipe) and had at other french restaurantes was very mediocre. Very thin and bland sauce, I think they served me two chicken legs - a very americanized version of this great dish. Wifes salmon was good but again not french IMO.

We won't come back.

Really good jazz band playing in the front window though!
author: T H.

description:
I really enjoyed this restaurant.  My husband and I stumbled across this place while walking around the area while visiting San Francisco.  It was hoppin' on a Sunday night, so I immediately made reservations for the next evening and I'm glad I did.  I started with the French onion soup, which was quite cheesy and delightful and exactly what I was expected.  For my entrée, I ordered the French classic, coq au vin.  It was my first time having coq au vin and I must say - I was impressed!  It was flavorful and juicy and just all sorts of yumminess.  Since I have never had the dish before, I cannot say if it was authentic or the best ever . . . all I can say is that it was pretty damn good!

We did not have room for dessert, but the wine list was good and the waiter recommended a nice pairing for my meal.  The services was good and the décor was clean and modern.  It can get a little noisy when it gets busy and I would not recommend this place for a romantic evening, but more for a causal meal or an evening with friends.  The also have an outdoor seating area with heaters.  

I would definitely stop by again on my next trip to San Francisco and would recommend that you eat here too.  Don't forget to make a reservation for the quickest seating!
author: Jenn T.

description:
I was in town for work (having previosuly lived in SF) and have heard so many good things about this place.  One of my friends eats here all the time so I figured I would give it a try with her.  It was a Sunday night and wasn't that busy which was nice.  We started off with the Escargot en Croute which were amazing. I loved the dish it was served it., had little holes for each of the escargot.  We also had a glass of the Cotes du Rhone which was very tasty and different.  It was a bit spicy which went perfect with all the different flavors in the app and also the dinner.  

We both ordered the Ahi tuna.  OMG is was cooked to perfections and had the most amazing bacon confit as a side.  It was yummy.

The waiter was very nice and wasn't annoying.  She let us enjoy our food and conversation.  We ended the meal with the flourless chocolate cake.  It was nice and light and a great way to end the meal.  Although I wasn't on a date I thought it was a cute little spot to go on a date or even catch up with a friend.
author: Sonia D.

description:
We went on a sat. Ambience was nice.
Live music was good. A good place to take ur gf/better half out.

Trout was really good. Chicken was nice.
Trouffle mousse (appetizer) did not go well with our taste buds.

Overall a gr8 pl.
Damage: $95 for 2 (drinks+appetizer+main course)

Wife was happy...so money well spent ;)
author: Nitin B.

description: I'm a sucker for good French food & good service. I love that Cafe Claude is tucked away in one of San Francisco's beautiful alleys, away from the hustle & bustle of Union Square. The jazz band just completes the picture of a very non-SF experience. Make a reservation & sit outdoors since they have tents & heaters set up anyway.
author: Beverly R.

description:
A little bit of Paris in San Francisco. Wonderful.

Tucked away on a small side street Cafe Claude serves fresh and delicious French-American cuisine. 

Appetizer: Fruit, Cheese and Nut Plate.
Dinner : the table shared fillet mignon, roasted chicken, pasta special.

I felt comfortable and relaxed the entire night - great place.
author: Emily C.

description:
I've been here about 8x in 2 years, both for lunch and dinner. This place is just perfect in every regard, though some of the newer wait staff could be less robotic. 

The location as others have noted, is in an alley. The fare is reasonably priced for French, and they have a quite decent selection of wines.

I have to assume that the experience varies dramatically, depending on whether you sit inside or outside in the alley. I've only sat outside, in season. To me, that's the charm of this place -- to be able to dine in the alley, watch people, and to sit under the heaters in the tent, even on the coldest winter days.

The place is casual, and is comfortable in every regard. This is my all-time-favorite bistro in SF.
author: El Huron I.

description: Sorry to report but we loved this restaurant a few years ago but today on a Saturday we would never come here again. From start to finish the service was  terrible. We ordered a salad and sandwich for lunch and it took over an hour and was cold. They didn't apologize just barely acknowledge what a fall down they had here. We love french bistros so it is sad to see this one go away. Don't go here - way too many new restaurants who care about the customer and are working hard to deliver a great dining experience. As a side note we travel and eat out often and are not that demanding so when we write a review like this it is meaningful.
author: Shannon V.

description: The best steak tartare I've ever had with excellent service to boot. Was in San Francisco for a week, and this was the only repeat restaurant. Went for both lunch and dinner. Very, very good. Very authentic feel.
author: David S.

description: Quaint french restaurant located in a small alley way in Union Square area. Food was pretty decent just very overpriced what we received... The food was not "high quality" enough for them to be charging the high price point which it is. Nonetheless nothing that we ordered on the menu was bad and if price was not a object.. I would probably come back for some casual dining.. If I am to spend 50-60 on a dinner I would expect it to be much better.
author: James H.

description:
Hands down, the best french onion soup I've had in the bay area! YOU MUST TRY IT HERE!!!

Hard to find, but very cute and homey. Perfect place to catch up with an old friend or for a quiet date.
author: Tien P.

description:
The location of this restaurant adds to the atmosphere and the "French cafe" experience. Although, if you're placed outside, you're like to end up sitting quite close to another group. 

My meal consisted of a shared order of escargots and the evening special of braised rabbit. My friend ordered the regular duck confit. Our dessert was a traditional creme brûlée.

The escargot was delicious as expected. 
I especially liked how each snail had a small bread top on it. Almost like a mini biscuit topping. The braised rabbit was good, but there was  much more white meat then I had expected. Personally, I like a good balance of fat and lean. Lastly, the creme brûlée was nice but not amazing.
author: KJ M.

description:
Food was OK! nothing impressive. 
Location is kinda hidden and not nice. Construction is going on right in front of it. 
My server was not friendly and like "oh! I-am-tired or I-don't-like-my-job kinda person" Not even listening to what we were ordering and zoning out.... then she was like "excuse me, what?"

Also, bathrooms were not so clean.
author: Maria H.

description:
Food - Amazing 
Dessert - Amazing 
Service - Amazing 

I just taking one star out because the restaurant is too crowded and tables are too together, I mean real estate is expensive in NY as well but do not make you sit this close
author: Vikram D.

description: Perfect lunch spot. Ive only been here for lunch not dinner.  Nice outside ally way tables and delicious food. Ive had macaroni gratine sooo good and the potatoe one with a glass of vino. Simply delious!
author: Jess O.

description:
Arrived Monday evening for a last minute reservation.  Staff was friendly, informed, gracious and attentive.  The food however was nothing to write home about, although it was good, it just wasn't special.

Confit Duck Canard with green lentils.  Duck fell off the bone, however I found the dish to be bland.  My date had the Coq au Vin, again fell off the bone, a little more flavor than the duck, however again lacking in flavor.  The major disappointments were the wines by the glass and my dessert.  My date was not drinking due to an early morning meeting, so I wanted a glass of French Rosé, there was only one, a Grenache.  I was surprised they did not offer a rosé from Provence, even by the bottle.    As for dessert, well it was a HUGE disappointment.  We had the Mousse Au Chocolat.  After two bites we sent it back...it tasted like "instant pudding."

Bottom line, I would go back again, as the food was predictable, you know you are going to have a decent meal, just not a stellar meal.
author: Maureen R.

description:
We love this place and have had dinner here many times. Music on weekend nights is great. 

Beware if eating outside by Claude Lane, you may be solicited by a homeless person or two. If u're not from SF or otherwise not comfortable with that, eat inside to avoid unwanted surprises !
author: Shruti Y.

description:
My girlfriend and I came during a slow time, right before the dinner rush. We ordered pate, salad, and french onion soup for starters. It took a hour to get our appetizers. My french onion soup had a foil butter wrapper underneath the cheesy exterior. Need I say more?

We left without tasting any of their food.
author: Khiem T.

description: I left feeling overstuffed because I couldnt help but finish every last bite as well as order dessert. Their dishes all sounded really delicious and from the looks of the meals around me, they were most likely amazing. I asked them to leave out a couple ingredients from my meal since I am a veggie and they happily obliged. The waitress was wonderful and took care of our orders and let us change our meals from our initial order with no problems. The atmosphere was lovely with the live jazz and the outside dining area looked really romantic. I love how it is in a quiet unassuming alley in the city.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Everytime i am in San Francisco I always stop by for a visit - love their trout dish!
author: John E.

description:
French restaurants have become a thing for the bf and I.  Ever since we went to one for NYE when we were in NYC, we love frequenting French restaurants and trying new foods there.  Before going to see Wicked we came here for dinner.  It is tucked away on a side street and once you walk in you feel like you have escaped to a French bistro in Paris.  The ambience is amazing and the food is top notch. 

We were seated immediately when we arrived and started off with drinks.  A martini for the bf and I had the French 75 which was the equivalent of pink champagne.  Pretty good stuff, the bf LOVED his martini so much that we ordered another round for him.  Now on to the food... I ordered the Coq Au Vin (thanks Top Chef for helping me know what this was), and the bf ordered the Pan seared trout.  The food was awesome, the red wine sauce of my coq au vin was really great.  The bf's trout was also yummy, the lemon and mushroom flavor was a good.  We ordered the creme brulee for dessert which was tasty and a nice glass of brut for my second round of drinks (pics of our food are uploaded).  

They play jazz on Saturday nights from 7:30 to 10:00, and the musicians were setting up by the time we had finished our meal, so weren't able to hear them play, but I wouldn't mind coming back for a drink and some jazz..  Another great French restaurant to add to our list!
author: Alana A.

description:
Dreadful place. Treated like crap, made to wait for a table even though we booked. My party had 3 big people so the table was "too tight" for us. Waited ages for appetizers while others came, ate, and went. Food average. Attitude arogant just like real Frenchies. 18% automatic tip for 6 people - what?
No recompense for the embarrassment and hassle they caused me. Don't bother even thinking about this place.
author: Catherine S.

description: While enjoying a weekend in San Francisco we had a fabulous dinner at Cafe Claude. The entire evening, the music, food and atmosphere was perfect.
author: Toni R.

description: I'm a little confused by the star rating this place gets. First the good: this feels like a special discovery, tucked away in a little alley. The ambiance is nice. Mood lighting, live music by the bar. But for the price, the food is really just okay. The french onion soup was bland. Brandade was okay. Coq au vin-- okay but nothing to knock your socks off. Overall, I give it a shoulder shrug. You can eat far better in SF for far less.
author: Karen P.

description:
Great atmosphere with good jazz. Fabulous French wine list. I had the roasted chicken with the burgundy served by the glass.  Nice service and good crowd. 
Apple tart for dessert with sauterne was lovely.
author: Lil Y.

description:
Love the atmosphere with the Jazz music.  Not a fan for the food. 

Will go back for a drink, but not dinner.
author: Xue Y.

description:
I've always loved Cafe Claude.  Yummy drinks, yummy food and cozy surroundings.  

Poppy was such a pudge last night...and an unhealthy one at that...3 kinds of pate to start, followed by steak tartare (she needed iron!) with fries and aoili(because fried fat with fat sauce is delicious) and seared ahi smothered in bacon and buttery onions.

I always have a better time here when there isn't live music.  Perhaps I'm too sensitive but I typically find the bands to be unbearably loud.  I suppose that's good if you hate the person you're going to eat with or if you're shy and have nothing to say!
author: Poppy C.

description: Second time at Cafe Claude for a business lunch.  Nice atmosphere on Claude alley for outdoor dining.  Had the special Quiche Lorraine and my dining partners had the Croque Monsiour and the Croque Madame.  Both gave the dishes thumbs up.  A good spot for a nice leisurely lunch.
author: Robert J.

description:
I love their lunch! great sandwiches and quiche.

dinner was a big disappointment- not great quality, very small portions, very expensive. 

The atmosphere here is awesome, and is great for a nice treat for lunch, but I would not recommend dinner.
author: Jessica Y.

description: Great place for a date and pretty affordable! Took my BF here for his birthday and it was perfect. We ordered a chicken dish with vegetables, potatoes- in this yummy wine sauce. Really hardy. The onion soup wasn't that great, too much cheese for me but my BF liked it. The creme brûlée was a definite must, I noticed everyone was getting that. Next time I go back I would like to try there wine. The offered half bottles which is nice.
author: Lisa W.

description:
I never thought a restaurant this good would have a main entrance positioned mid stream in an alley...but we sure did enjoyed our visit.

We ordered the trout, filet mignon and fries.  Everything was wonderful and properly cooked.  Even the fries were a hit because of the incredible sauce that they included on the side.

The service was great.  I think our waiter (Josh) was part sommelier and part server.  Whatever the combination, he administered the perfect dose of attentiveness.
author: Trust But Verify 1.

description:
I always really enjoy my meals at Cafe Claude. For lunch, make sure you make reservations because it's a popular spot. If it's a nice day in San Francisco, they have outside seating in the alley. The atmosphere is so charming and it's a great date location.

I like that the waitresses (I don't know if they all can) can speak French. They're very personable and friendly and service is always good.

Their cheese plates are delicious and I'd also recommend the pate if you like it.

I've eaten there quite often. I had the tuna tartare with goat cheese and the ingredients very fresh and delicious. I really enjoy the pork tenderloin served with apples in a honey mustard sauce. I normally don't order tenderloin because it tends to be dry but it's cooked perfectly here. The sweetness of the apples and honey mustard pair with the pork nicely. This is probably one of my favorite dishes here. The pan-seared trout, almonds, white mushroom lemon sauce, fingerling potatoes, romano beans is an excellent choice if you're looking for something a little lighter for dinner. I've also had the coq au vin and enjoyed it immensely. 

They always have a pasta of the day and a different daily special so be sure to ask!
author: Jackie T.

description:
I love this place!!! Went for first time with my friend and had to bring my hubby here for him to try.

Appetizer:
Escargot:  it was good but I have had better. Think not enough garlic and lacked a bit in flavor

Pate:  my favorite was the truffle mousse. Hubby liked the shredded rabbit.

Main course:
Lamb:  perfectly cooked in red wine sauce. It was sooo flavorful and the meat was cooked perfect

Hubby had the pasta special: it was just ok

Next time we want to try the French onion soup.  Definitely worth coming back to.
author: Fonda C.

description: Cafe Claude is so charming! Perfect place for brunch, the food is delicious and reasonable! Such a great place. Get the Croque Madame you won't be disappointed.
author: Julia E.

description:
I have encountered some weird things down alleys, so when my friend started guiding me down this particular one, I was preparing myself. 
Cafe Claude is nestled down there pretty well, and well worth the time to find it. The inside is cozy and on those amazing San Fran afternoons, outdoor seating is the way to be. Promptly seated, and with a spunky waitress i was ready to get my eat on...french style. 

Because I am a lady at lunch time, I ordered the salad nicoise. I have had this messed up so many times in the past, that I was beyond happy with my plate appeared with big ol seared tuna pieces, tons of green beans, and light on the potatoes. Nice they understand that if I wanted potato salad, id ask for that. Win, win! The salmon totally out-shined my salad. Well, not the fish itself but the fava bean stew. One needs to bathe in it. 

Lucky for me, it ended up to be the best ally experience ever. Except for that one time....
author: Spencer N.

description:
Café Claude is neatly tucked away in its own side street (Claude Lane) and has ample outdoor seating (which is very à la française).

I came here last night with a friend for dinner and for their weekend jazz performance. Although we were seated outside, we could still hear the smooth jazz music playing from inside. We both ordered the French onion soup (a bit heavy but the gruyere cheese on top was divine); and we shared the coq au vin (SOOO good and filling. The meat was so tender and I was able to effortlessly peel it off the bone. It also makes me want to crack open my Barefoot Contessa's Barefoot in Paris to retry her coq au vin recipe).

Another plus for great service - waiters were very courteous and always came around to check on us/refill our waters.

A+ Chez Claude.
author: Christina C.

description: This is a very cute place and I enjoyed sitting outside in the ally. I ordered a French martini and it was delicious, but it was so small for the price-I hear this may be a new trend and I don't think I love it, but at least the drink was very well made and tasted great! For my entree I ordered the mahi mahi served in a tomato sauce- I believe it may have been a special that night. The dish was really good; the fish was cooked perfectly, the tomatoes tasted very fresh and everything was well seasoned. I really enjoyed trying this place and I'd like to visit again and try the Nicoise salad.
author: Natalie M.

description:
OMG - I love French food, and now I love Cafe Claude.  During a short wait at the bar, I decided to try Le Garcon.  A non-alcoholic drink of mango, pineapple, and cranberry juices.  Fabulous.  We were also treated to a little taste of ahi tuna tartare on a garlic crostini.  That only made me hungry for more.  The tuna was so fresh and just melted in my mouth.

We started dinner off with escargot (yes, you have to dip the bread into the garlic oil - you just have to), and the red beet salad.

Entrees - I had their special steak frites, with a red wine reduction sauce and greens.  I need the recipe to that sauce.  Hubby had the pasta special.  I believe it was penne (sorry, forgot) with shrimp.  For a pasta dish, it was amazingly light.  So good.

Dessert - Can you believe it?  We actually got dessert! We shared the creme coconut (coconut flan) and an apple tarte.  Yes, the flan was amazing (my fave).  Apple tarte was devoured by my hubby who likes his desserts very sweet.

A fabulous evening thanks to our friend Sophie.  If you get seated in her section, be nice to her!   She's the best.
author: Denise M.

description:
The first time I tried Cafe Claude was with my boyfriend a few years ago and the last time I came here was with that same guy except he is no longer my boyfriend.  Now don't get me wrong, our relationship status has nothing to do with this.  We just so happened were planning to catch up since he was in town (and nothing more than that if you were thinking so... haha) and a lot of the places we considered were closing because we had to go after I got off work and so we were thinking of a great place around the downtown area.  We both agreed that we would LOVE to find that French restaurant we went to for lunch back when we were dating and since I remembered what street it was on but not the name, I simply googled "french restaurant by bush street" and this place came up on top.  I was 100% it was the place because the name sounded so familiar so we gave it a try! Didn't take long to find parking (thank goodness) and we saw the nostalgic ally way it hides in and we were SO happy! They weren't too busy either so we were able to get seats pretty fast.  You would not believe how nostalgic that place was to us.  It was definitely a different setting and some decorations were different (I mean, come on, it's been YEARS since the last time we were both here) but we had so much fun recalling where we were sitting, what was around, and etc.  

So a few years ago we came here for lunch and ordered some sandwiches with pommes frites which are delicious.  I love thin fries and it's what they serve here.  This time around, we were here for dinner and I seriously wanted to try everything. We started off with the pommes frites of course and escargot (the last time I had it was in France so I had some expectations of it).  The escargot did NOT disappoint me at all.  It tasted so similar to the one I had in France at Le Zeyer but they added fromage on top which I thought was such an interesting touch, which made it all the more amazing! I believe I ordered the Confit De Canard that night and my date had the Coq Au Vin.  I seriously loved that duck.  The texture was exquisite and I'm REALLY picky when it comes to food texture, but it was on point.  Trust me, this night was amazing with the food and atmosphere and I guess my date too ;)  And of course, I cannot end a french dinner without crème brûlée! A-may-zingggg! I mean, it's not the best I've had but I just love crème brûlée hehe I will definitely come back again and I recommend anyone to try this place!
author: Lisa L.

description: Coque au vin is OK. The highlight of the evening was the warm chocolate lava cake with a small cold pitcher of vanilla cream.
author: Christian E.

description:
Café Claude is a charming place to celebrate and indulge in a reasonably priced French meal.  By reasonably priced, I don't mean cheap.  On the other hand, they won't bend you over and break the bank like other French restaurants.  Plus, the food is fantastic.  The café is tuck away in a narrow alley bordering Union Square and the FiDi.  They have a delightful patio that is great on warm, sunny days - heat lamps make it bearable during the chilly San Francisco days.  Inside you'll find an elegant but casual atmosphere.  Dinners are always lively, though the dining room is never too loud to enjoy a pleasant conversation with your dining companions.  

For dinner, we skipped wine and went straight to charcuterie.  Our first course was their pate plate, a choice of their three house made pates.  We went with the rillette du perigord, sauterne mousse, and truffle mouse.  The rillette was made with shredded duck meat and duck fat.  Honestly, it was my least favorite because it conflicted so much with the other selections.  The sauterne was quite nice.  This combination of chicken liver, truffles, and cepes had a sweet aftertaste and a pleasant texture.  The truffle mousse was outstanding.  Deep, rich, and creamy, the truffle carried an beautiful low note that lingered, enticing you to make spread after spread.  

Next came a petit plat de escargot en croute.  Holy butter bandit batman!  These vehicles for butter, garlic and salt made me roll me eyes into the back of my head as I groaned "oooooooooooohhhhhhhhhh!."  The snails are served sans pesky shells, reducing the mess of having to pick those pesky buggers apart.

Our entrée was their special of the day, duck leg confit with braised chard and fingerling potatoes.  Damn!  Tender, succulent, moist - the duck leg melted away in your mouth.  The rich sauce, a beautiful, dark and deep broth, made me want to lick my plate clean.  The chard was cooked to perfection and the potatoes were little buttery starch balls.  For sh*ts and giggles we tried the pommes frites - fresh, crunchy and delicious.  

Café Claude is delightful restaurant with great service and fantastic food.  I will definitely be back again and I can't wait to try their sister restaurant Gitane in the near future.
author: Thomas S.

description:
I really liked this place for brunch. I was visiting in town and wanted to impress that I could find a cool place. Thankfully she hadn't been there yet (though she heard of it, in fact she has heard of every place in town so I couldn't win that game).

Food was yummy and the atmosphere was busy but comfortable. I want to go back to try some jazz - of course when I am back in town.
author: Chris G.

description:
Love the tucked away - off an alley - location.  Felt like a secret gem I'd discovered.

Only con - I expected just a tiny bit more service for the amount of money I paid, but I could see they were very busy, and not just ignoring me.  Also the fact that I was a table for one, I did appreciate the nice seat they gave me, as opposed to sticking me somewhere else.

The Nicoise salad was lovely.  The creme brulee - f-ing amazing.  I posted a pic for my friends on FB, and a number of people admitted to drooling.  Yummy lunch!
author: Holly O.

description: Cafe Claude is good for groups. They have outdoor seating under heat lamps. The cheese appetizer with toasted walnut bread and plum sauce is absolutely delicious here. The escargot and patte are mediocre but the creme brulee with cappuccino is awesome. The decor is decent but nothing to rave about. The best time to go there is for dinner on Thu and Fri night when they have live Jazz.
author: Monish S.

description: Such a cute and quaint shop! Excellent food and amazing service! Can't wait to come back!
author: Shea W.

description:
You like a little nook with good jazz music and really good food then you have come to the right place. We arrive here Saturday night 7 ish and waited at the bar for only 20 mins. Sat us at a table right outside the band which was good since we didn't have to deal with the crowd. My date and I ordered the duck, rustic lasagna, sweet pea soup and the liver spread platter and it was all amazing. To top it off they made in mistake in sending us potatoes au gratin but the waitress said no charge. Inside the decor is laid back not too flashy, the only thing I would worry about is coming in too late and wait for a long time. Sure its a little pricey but you are in the city at night for your average worker. Either way since we found this place on a fluke this is definitely going to be a destination worth coming back to.

Note: this restaurant like the rest of them are close to the hotels you might be staying.
author: Cuth G.

description:
I don't even remember what I ordered for myself when I came here with two of my co-workers, all I could think about for two weeks after that was the one bite of my friend's Croque Monsieur sandwich that I had. It was like experiencing a glimpse of heaven, five consecutive orgasms and an internal nuclear meltdown all in one mouthful of bread and Gruyere cheese. 

I haven't been back since, but i have fond memories of that sandwich - now I spend my days at work looking for a similar alternative closer to San Jose.
author: Aivy C.

description:
Started with the chacuterie plate and that was a lot of food.  Wonderful pate (duck, pork, chicken).  They have steak tartare and I've lived to tell you it's worth the risk.  Yummy.  Tableside presentation.  Delicious and the portion was quite large, at least for raw meat.  My fiance had the special of the night (shank or something) and all I saw was the bone 10 minutes later.  Ambiance is quite romantic for dinner.  Tables are pretty close, dark, music in the background, sometime a band.  

For brunch/lunch, my girlfriend and I just felt so special sitting outdoor having French soup/sandiwches/salad/dessert.  Every dish is wonderful and I'd recommend sitting outdoor during the day.  Love the French accent of the servers.  Oooh la la
author: Yvonne Y.

description: Escargot was prepared in the traditional way with Garlic Butter and parsley.  The Onion soup was OK, just a little too salty.  The steak tartar was done correctly.  Nothing tasted bad, however it is not in the same league as a great restaurant.  If you need a French Food fix this might do the trick.  However, I might not be coming back too soon.  The service was good.
author: Jim J.

description:
Great food and service. I have been there twice, they never let me down.
Awesome wine selection and desert. The cocktail also nice to try,
Definitely worth to try.
author: Jon C.

description:
All I wanted after downing the better part of three punchbowls at Rickhouse last night (BIRTHDAY!!) was COW, preferably still mooing.

The steak tartare at Cafe Claude totally did the trick.  Prepared tableside, they made it perfectly to my taste.  Lovely texture, super-fresh meat, I couldn't have been happier.

My friends' lasagna, seared scallops, etc were also delish.  Hey, it's my birthday... I can totally eat off everyone else's plate!
author: Caitlin M.

description:
Lately I've been going to many of my old time favorites in the city that I've already yelped about, but this time we both agreed to go somewhere we haven't been to before.  We went on a Thur night last month. I love the location of Cafe Claude hidden in the same alley as Gitane... but even the Uber guy got us sort of lost . 
I remember it was raining that night, but there were still people sitting out in the alley with a tent-like covering.
As we entered, I was completely enamored with the live jazz music playing which simply seduced those entering the romantic ambiance. My date chose an amazing Cabernet Sauvignon from France... I forgot the name of it... :(
My favorite that night was definitely the steak Kobe tartare. I normally try to write a Yelp review soon after my experience, but I've been going to so many of my old-time favorites, that I simply just forgot. I can't remember our main entrees, but I do know we had my all time favorite dessert... Creme brûlée.
I recall the service was a bit slow, but very friendly. Well overall this is a fabulous date place!
author: Myra M.

description: Food okay.  Service okay.  Cabillaud a la Basquaise was okay.  Bisque de Mais was okay. Saurternes Mousse was okay.  The porc was okay. Creme brulee was burnt.  The cocktails were pretty good.  French 75 French Martini,  Maison Egalite were okay also.  I might come back here because this place seems to guarantee okay.
author: Byron L.

description: My boyfriend and I booked this place for Valentine's Day this year.  We originally wanted to come here last year, but we booked too late and this restaurant couldn't accommodate us.  Now that we're smarter now and booked ahead of time, we are both very excited to dine here in a few weeks.  I booked online on 1/13 through yelp for a table at around 6 pm.  My boyfriend and I love jazz music, which was main reason why we chose this place.  Plus, the food looks amazing via yelp photos (Thanks guys!! :D), and the decor looks great.  Through their website, it stated that jazz music starts at 7:30 pm.  I thought that since our reservation was around 6 pm, we would probably only listen to about 30 minutes of jazz music (which is better than none).  However, I received a call the next day (1/14) from a woman who wanted to confirm my reservation for Valentine's Day.  She also called to tell me that Cafe Claude will be doing a prix fixe menu that day.  The menu has not been finished yet, but will be posted online by 1/25.  She was very nice and answered all of my questions (I had a lot because I wanted Valentine's Day to be perfect; who can blame me? lol).  One of my questions was regarding the jazz music (because I thought we would only hear 30 minutes of it).  She told me that on Valentine's Day, the band would play at 6:30 pm instead of the usual 7:30 pm.  I was so happy because now my boyfriend and I get to enjoy the music that we both love while eating.  I also asked about the seating because I wasn't sure if I had the option to choose either to sit outside or inside the restaurant.  She told me (again, very nicely) that since we had made a reservation, we are automatically to be seated inside unless we want to sit outside.  All in all, she deserves 5 stars for her awesome service (and patience) with me, and both my boyfriend and I are very excited to enjoy our dinner on Valentine's Day.
author: Diana H.

description: This is definately a hidden gem. It's cozy and intimate decor won my date some brownie points. The food, dessert and wine were all delicious. The service was impeccable and I was overall pleased with my dining experience here.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Dined in the alley which actually was a lot nicer than it sounds. I odered the lamb shank soley to annoy my vegitarian girlfriend. "Oh it has a giant bone sticking out of it, yeah I'll have that." Yeah I'm a charmer. It was okay, I think I'd try something else if I went again. I ordered a Solace from the bar because I wanted to try cucmber vodka which went from interesting to blah by the end of the drink. The service was great. I think if you find something on the menu that excites you than go for it.
author: Neil C.

description: I stumbled upon this place one night while trying to find a free parking space. The alley dining reminded me of brasseries in Lyon. We had a late dinner, and the inside dining was full so we got the alley dining experience!  On this visit we ordered the foie gras  for the app, we selected rabbit, pork, chicken & goose; this was my first time having pâté and the rabbit was our favorite a bit spicy, very fatty taste but "oh so good!" For the entrée we order the steak and lamb chops; the steak was good but what stole the show that night was the black bean reduction it was very tasty! I usually like beef flavor but this steak needed some serious help and that sauce was the savior. As far as the lamb, it was good nothing spectacular.  The only reason I'd be back would be for the Black Bean Sauce.
author: Joe Buck s.

description: A nice French restaurant, with interesting plated escargot. Had a nice soufflé, Coque au vin, and  I remember the desserts were yummy too. Located in a short alley. Food was pretty good and interesting. A nice place for a French dinner.
author: Felecia W.

description:
I think I'd also go for 3 1/2 stars, if possible.

I loved the ambiance here -- the tables are far enough away from each other, the music was great and at a perfect volume, it's got a really classy vibe.

The selections on the menu were great, too. Although the food was very good, I was a little bit disappointed, especially by the service. 

It took forever to get our order taken, and we weren't asked once -- not once -- how the meal was or if we'd like another drink. Meanwhile, the table next to us got free amuse-bouches sent to them by the chef and lots of check-ins. While it was obvious they were friendly with the manager, you'd think the manager and waitress might pay some attention to the very (very!) thirsty couple seated right next to them.

As for our meal: the trout was delicate and delicious, as were the string beans accompanying them. The flavor & texture of the steak tartar was divine. I was disappointed with my lamb, though-- I thought the sauce was salty and heavy, and the beans were tough and mealy.  My date, however, loved the lamb & beans.

I think for French food itself, there are better places in the city, but the atmosphere of Cafe Claude makes this a great date place.
author: Dina G.

description:
Today a friend and I went for lunch and sat inside since it is rather chilly in SF these days!  Was very happy with the experience all around. Neither of us had the luxury of a very long lunch since it was a busy work day, and fortunately the waitress was very attentive. We had a great meal and didn't have to wait long at all to be seated or served.

I had the salmon with pesto sauce and it was absolutely delicious! Best salmon dish I've had in a long time! Highly recommend!

I hope to come back soon!
author: Rosie S.

description: Cafe Claude was truly a romantic and cozy place to have dinner! My boyfriend and I had great service from all staff and LOVED the jazz trio playing! We had both had the  onion soup which was super delicious! We loved the chocolate cake with French vanilla bean creme! Loved our cocktails as well! This was my first trip to San Francisco and will definitely be coming back and going to cafe Claude!
author: Alyssa S.

description:
there I was, just another hungry college student on a budget just finishing some homework on a saturday night

I first came to cafe claude with the intention of watching their live jazz for a jazz history report. the food came second. But who could ignore the ambiance of such a romantic French restaurant in a Union Square alley? cafe claude made me sick. love sick.  the dim lights, the sensual jazz tunes, the low small talk buzz of people on dates. I wish my boyfriend was there, but I got stuck with two friends I dragged along so I wouldn't look like such a square. good enough

cafe claude was pretty busy that night and we had no reservations, so we ended up waiting for about half an hour. folks, make reservations. it got kind of awkward waiting on some dirty steps nearby, in the cold, listening to music. anyway, our hostess finally sat us at a table outside providing a good view of the back's of the musicians (boo) but that was fine. I could hear the music. I ordered the Coquilles Saint Jacques dish and all that jazz report biznaz went out the door. it was delicious! the best dish I have ever had in san francisco! the scallop, shrimp, mushrooms, gruyere cheese in two scallop shells with bread crumbs and a side of spring mix with dressing. it was rich and I could taste every bit of everything. you have to believe me! 

our waiter was fabulous! he was friendly and checked up on us every now and then, filling our bread bowl whenever it ran low. as I've said before, thumbs up for free bread

in the next weeks that followed, I turned in that jazz report blah blah blah but the one part of cafe claude that stuck with me was the taste of that seafood dish. no joke!
author: kathleen d.

description:
Cafe Claude is very well priced for the quality of food and service you receive.  Our server was awesome- super friendly and helpful.

I think their tuna tartar is better than the beef.  Yes, we got both.

The escargots is not overpowered with garlic which is nice.  The lamb was prepared well and was tender.  The creme brulee was also yummy.

We also ordered the goose liver mousse which was a bit too livery tasting for us.  I think the issue wasn't the mousse because it was prepared well and the texture was light and creamy but I don't think we were expecting such a pungent liver taste.  We were expecting more of a pate kind of taste.

Cafe Claude is a great spot, I recommend it.
author: Becca L.

description: Great place and great food! It had a romantic ambiance and extremely helpful and friendly waiters. I only docked a star because I thought my pork dish was a little dry, but everything else we ordered was delicious. Order the duck confit, it is absolutely amazing! The escargot was good too, though a little expensive for its small portion size.
author: May L.

description:
This place made me smile as soon as I walked in.  It's just so damn adorably Parisian in here, from the ol' skool ceiling fans, to the eiffel tower candle "toppers", and even the swinging kitchen doors!  I love how it's tucked away in an alleyway too, away from the normal crazy hustle and bustle of downtown.

Came here after reading about it in 7x7's "Where to Eat in Union Square" and am quite ashamed that even being from the City and a frequent visitor to Union Square now that I live out of town, I've never discovered this place!

We had the pommes frites (fries), the soup du jour: Roasted Tomato Soup, Escargots, and the Onion Soup Gratinée

Everything was delicious!  Their escargots was easily the best I've had ever, both soups were perfect for the rather overcast winter afternoon, and their fries were of perfect crispiness!  

So so sooo good!  Will most definitely be back!  Can't wait to try more of what they have to offer!
author: Crys L.

description:
My husband and I had reservations for 8 on a Saturday night - 11/20/2010. We were not able to be seated immediately because of course it was busy on a Sat. night with live music too! But the wait wasn't long and the music was great. We really enjoyed our meal - it's been a long time since we had French cuisine this good.  
 
We did a trio of appetizers - a pate, pappas frites (yummy) and french onion soup (each). Guess we were eager to try a lot of options and we were not disappointed.

My husband had the pork with carmelized apples - tender and delicious! 
I opted for the scallop, mussel, and shrimp small plate -- it was rich and creamy with a crusted bread topping (made me wish I hadn't eaten earlier in the day to truly enjoy this filling and delectable dish). Even though it was only 2 clam shell halves, it was more than sufficient to enjoy - again they were filling and delicious.

Service was slow - our waiter seemed overwhelmed as again they were quite busy on a Sat. nite.

Word of note to those who don't like unlike unkept bathrooms - the bathroom is out back and is shared with multiple businesses (not under direct control of the restaurant) so it is lacking for cleanliness for a restaurant of this caliber. 

*************also*******
An additional note: The restaurant's management is to be commended for their attention to detail in serving their customers. While I was there on vacation and it is not possible to be a regular customer, the management made note of the Yelp* review and is actively using the reviews to better serve their clientele. That is just about unheard of and so I have changed my rating to 5 stars becacuse this is the kind of service you rarely get and deserves mention! 

And honestly, the building's property management should do more to service its tenants by providing cleaning service that meets the needs of all its tenants.
author: Carol T.

description:
I am a big fan of all the restaurants that hide in the little alleys of Union Square.  I first heard of Cafe Claude when I was perusing a list of Dine About Town participants.  After reading reviews on Yelp describing the great food and ambiance, I was ecstatic to try.  

Cafe Claude did live up to the hype.  The food was good, with ahi tuna tartare being my favorite.  But what I loved more than the food was the live jazz music that accompanied our dinner.
author: Bert N.

description: Always a solid choice for classic French bistro fares.
author: Denis Y.

description:
Cafe Claude is one of the first restaurants I've ever eaten at here in the city, which is maybe why I am so fond of it.  The atmosphere is very intimate and a perfect place for that romantic first date without feeling corny and like you're trying just a little too hard...

Located near Union Square, it is off the beaten path enough to avoid a flood of tourists trying to get that "authentic" experience which saves the restaurant from trying to guess if you're a tourist or not, too.

I highly recommend the beef tartare! They make it tableside - just another one of those touches that make this restaurant stand out in service.
author: Isaac S.

description: It should be 3.5 stars. My roommates and I went there to celebrate my birthday and one of the other roommate's birthday. Our waitress was attentive. The food was okay, but not impressive. I got the escargot and coq au vin.
author: jamie n.

description:
Cafe Claude is awesome.  I went there a few years ago with my friend Christy and enjoyed it so much that I still remember it.  Reasonable French food is hard to find, especially in SF.  The prices here won't blow you away, but definitely better than I was expecting.

This is some of the best French food I have had outside of France.  I had the steak tar-tar and really enjoyed it.  The atmosphere is also a lot of fun.  I'd definitely recommend it for a good place to take a date.  I'm a big fan of Cafe Claude and will likely be going back soon now that Yelp reminded me about it.
author: Brian G.

description: This place is fantastic. Hands down, one of the best restaurants I've been to for a while. The staff was so attentive and helpful. Our waiter recommended a wine to me, but after ordering a glass, I found it wasn't my favorite. Without a question, he took the glass away and brought two more for me to taste to ensure I had something I liked. I had the tuna and my boyfriend had the pork, both were absolutely delightful. The tuna was melt in your mouth good. We DEFIANTLY plan to go back.
author: Sarah B.

description:
ETA-

The owners have sent me a note in response to my review- I include it here along with my response to them- I will add a star for the nice note!

as per my policy of give and take as update-

They write-

"Dear Ricote F.,

Thank you for your recent review of Cafe Claude, we appreciate your feedback and would like to acknowledge the time you took to write about your experience with us. I do apologize that the service you received was delayed in any way. We pride ourselves on the efficiency of our staff and if you could provide me with any additional details about your visit, that would be very helpful. Thank you again and I look forward to hearing from you.

Kind Regards,

Jennifer Spratt
jen@claudelane.com
Ricote F.
a moment ago


I respond-

Hi Jennifer

Thank you for your note in kind- I will publish it as an add on to the review along with my reply.

I have been a long time customer and fan, and as I have indicated enjoy my lunches at Cafe Claude. There is no one detail to the information that I can give to you that would help, other than to say that this has always been my experience- and sometimes its ok and sometimes it is a bit not. The longest waits seem to be for the first beverage to arrive after ordering- if that helps any?

I think it is always a good thing to see managers and owners responding to Yelpers and hopefully we all benefit from the forum! See you soon!! "
author: Ricote F.

description:
Love this hidden treasure.  We stayed at the Palace Hotel and then took a short cab ride to this place, thanks to the concierge.  

The food was amazing.  I highly recommend this food and look forward to returning soon.
author: Laura S.

description:
I was recently in San Fran for business and managed to eke out some time to join a friend at Cafe Claude.  As we approached, the narrow alley, outdoor seating under an awning, and the cute Vespas parked outside immediately made me feel incredibly nostalgic for Europe.
We were seated outside, directly under one of the heaters, which was perfect since the evening was typically San Francisco-chilly.

We each ended up ordering Egalites for our drinks and an order of pomme frites for a starter.  The fries came to us hot and crispy, and also delightfully light!  I wish I knew the secret to creating such a perfect potato product! *swoon*

I had the pork medallions while my friend opted for the salmon special.  I will honestly say it was the best pork I've had to date.  It was incredibly tender and flavorful, and I used crusty bread to sop up every last delicious drop of sauce.  My friend's salmon was equally wonderful - the combination of herbs on the salmon provided such a fresh and flavorful taste.

During dinner, the food came quickly, and the waiter was attentive without being annoying.

I'm sorry to say that we didn't have room for dessert.  'Tis a sin, and one that I'll have to rectify the next time I'm in town.
author: Christine G.

description:
Ambiance is great.  Our waiter was basically a short-haired-modern-Fabio-character.  So, all in all the atmosphere was wonderful.  

I started with the french onion soup which I can safely say is over 50% cheese and crouton.  I'm not complaining, because, well, who complains about cheese and crusty bread?  But it could use a little more broth.  Wow, I can't even believe I just asked for more broth.  

Next I had the beet salad which was perfection.  I happen to love everything about beets (other than the stain they leave on your teeth, napkin and sometimes clothing).  The cheese in the salad was nom nom nom.  

It is a very nice lunch spot that I certainly recommend.
author: Amy N.

description:
4 or 4.5. Cafe Claude is tucked into a slightly dodgy-looking alley but is a very comfortable space. A good, classic bistro menu - the Coq au Vin and the Beef Tartare were both good. The tartare is prepared to taste tableside.

We left just as the musicians were warming up, which was a shame, since they might push this place up to a 5.
author: Robert J.

description:
My husband and I went here for le Quatorze Juillet. Though the festivities for this event were a disappointment, the restaurant was a good find. Some people find it nifty that this restaurant is in an alleyway but I don't but hey, the world isn't revolved around me! I can't really give 5 stars to any restaurant but this place comes close to quality french cuisine. It's the best we've had since we moved here from France. (please note we've only tried a good handful).

To start, my husband ordered for our party of 6 an Haut Médoc. Comme je ne bois pas d'alcool, il m'a dit que c'était une très bonne bouteille. To keep us from dying of hunger, they kept us calm with fresh bread and hurriedly brought us our plate of escargots topped with gratin. It was perfect btw! Then only reason we didn't want to wipe it clean was because we wanted to save room in our bellies!
