The dish was well worth the anticipation, especially when followed by their upside-down apple tart with caramel sauce and whipped cream. As a randomly chosen restaurant for a brief visit to San Francisco, I was thoroughly impressed.
author: Ali J.

description: This is a great little find. You need to book as it is always busy even in this economy. Great staff, excellent food and a real French feel to it.
author: Duncan L.

description: Ate here last night (01/31/06)  - place was just over 50% full when we sat at 8...grew a little by the time we left.  The wait staff was attentive, the pate's were good but too cold as the cheese plate was at the end. The wine was good and the meal was reasonably priced. Kudo's as a great date place. I'd sleep with a guy if he took me here...and if I was gay.
author: chris m.

description: Ah Cafe Claude . . . so perfectly french. Relax. Drink wine. Eat simple french bistro food. The consensus is that is a great place for a date, I think it is just a great place.
author: Noelle M.

description: Excellent dining experience here. Romantic and just dark enough. Loved the steak tartare and escargot. I' ve had better pate, but I wolfed it down all the same. Attentive service.
author: Whit P.

description: I really like Cafe Claude. It has standard french bistro dishes. We liked both the croque madame and monsieur. Also the steak with pommes  frites. The  salads and onion soup were also good. I have only been for lunch but want to come back for dinner and music. the prices for lunch were reasonable and they have interesting wines by the glass with a small but nice bar.
author: Mark S.

description: After a rude encounter at Gitane, we stumbled across Cafe Claude which was a delight.  Our waitress was perfect and the food was delicious.  Sitting outside sipping wine and eating French cuisine was utter bliss and I recommend this restaurant very much.  I had the endive salad with blue cheese and the Truite aux amandes afterwards, both were very good.  Didn't try dessert yet, but I will most definitely be back.  The three different girls who waited on us were not only sweet but very pretty and did their jobs very well.  Next I have to try them for lunch.
author: Ikey S.

description:
You know that credit card commercial where the rich young white lady asks her credit card customer service rep where to take her silver sugar daddy for a delicious Italian dinner- and then cut to them dining in Italy looking all sorts of pleased.  We kinda did that with Cafe Claude, cept for one of us had been there quite a bit before- and it was in an alley way in downtown San Fran, and well we are already in that city quite a bit, and well its not at all the same thing, except for the plane ride...  Either way... Cafe Claude delivered!  
The steak tartare is why we go back, and almost always what is ordered- unless a tempting grilled steak special is happening that night.  The menu is small but each item receives the fine details required.  Never has the food not impressed- and its as reliable as a bay fog.  
The atmosphere is the expected shi-shi decor of a French cafe in downtown Fran, but i actually prefer to eat in the alley way instead of inside the restaurant- its sort of adds a little to the whole "authentic experience."  
The servers are all french models, or models with faux french accents, but do a great job of pairing wine selections with meal choices.  They are attentive and understand how to make experiences memorable.  

One tip: Reservations are not always a requirement.  We have stopped in at an average dinner time and managed to get a table for two more than once.   So if you are in the area and jonesing for some french food served by french models and paired with california wine- just ask for Claude.  Well actually just ask for a table.  They'll get you seated and eat'ed.
author: Buzz B.

description: I love this place for a date -- the umbrellas and tables in the alley, the tables tucked away by booths at the window, vodka infusing in beautiful glass jars behind the bar, the mural across one full wall, the jazz vocalist crooning to a live band... all makes for a fabulous, though expensive, evening. So, I only go once in a while. And, when I already have a reason to be downtown -- like getting my hair cut at Festoon.
author: Sunset G.

description: Cafe Claude is the ideal place to take someone for a business lunch.  I had the special, which was a pasta with a cream sauce and peas.  I also really like the alley, where you can eat your food when there is nice weather.
author: Joanna S.

description: I made an on-line reservation for this restaurant to celebrate my 40th bday with a couple friends. We were immediately seated in a table with a perfect view of the live jazz band. The music was so pleasant to listen to and the restaurant had a charming french appeal. The service was great and the food was amazing, I ordered a seafood dish which included sauteed spinach and mashed potatoes, the fish was cooked to perfection and the serving portion was perfect and filling. I was concerned the serving might be small because I have been to other french restaraunts where the food portion is too small for the price but that was not the case here. The only con was that they didn't offer me a complimentary dessert for my bday, instead I got a glass of muscat dessert wine which I am not a fan of.
author: Dania M.

description: It's an incredibly beautiful place. Scrupulously maintained by watchful eyes of waiters and bartenders. Expensive but my, what a menu of mouthwatering delights! Ahi tuna was a masterpiece. Best cappuccino I've had in years. Made friends with the jazz band. Jazz is on Thu-Sat 7:30-10:30, I believe. Not a place to relax, but rather to soak in fabulous French culture and cuisine.
author: Anya B.

description: This restaurant is good.  Period.  Food is good, service is good, wine is good, atmosphere is good, wait is non-existent or bearable.  I just love it.  I mean, it's not the French Laundry, but I like it.
author: Wes M.

description:
Update (12/20/07)

So... after my original review, I received a VERY nice message from the manager at Cafe Claude apologizing for it taking so long for our entrees to come out and apologizing for the staff not acknowledging us or the delay of our food.  She assured me that the restaurant doesn't accept any discriminatory behavior from its staff, and I must admit while I didn't FEEL being discriminated against.. my mentioning of race was just a paranoid observation I guess.  

Anyway... I'd like to thank Cafe Claude for the note... I appreciate it. the courteous thought and customer concern.  it shows class.  I am changed my rating of this restaurant from 3 to 4 stars and highly recommend it.  I'm looking forward to going back!
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Original Review (12/17/07):

Been here twice... 

first time, went with a big group of people.... 7 or 8 I think.. on a sunday night... not crowded, service was great, food was great... I really enjoyed it... good times.. made me want to go back.

second time, went again with one friend.... on a busy friday night... love the atmosphere of this place... pretty upscale, but not pretentious or pricy... live music, but not too loud...anyway.. they had our table ready (I had made reservations on opentable)... sat to eat... ordered some pate's... pate's came out... the two tables next to us were seated... we ordered our entree and proceeded to wait for 45 minutes!!... the two tables on either side of us ordered their appetizer, got their appetizer, ordered their entree, got their entree, ordered their dessert, got their dessert during the time we were waiting for our entree... I mean it was OK... we were in no rush.. we sipped on wine and enjoyed our pate.... but cmon... it was weird that people who came in after us got their food so quickly and we had to wait so long... I dind't mind it taking so long... I mean.. maybe they made a mistake in the kitchen or forgot to put in our order or whatever... but cmon... the waiter said nothing the whole time.  He didn't apologize for it taking so long... didn't give us a reason or anything... If he had said anything or even acknowledged us I would have been OK with it... makes me wonder if it was because my friend and I were young-looking and asian.  Everyone else in the restaurant was older and... non-asian... I dunno.. probably not... just wondering outloud.... anyway, otherwise the food was good and me being the nice guy that I am, tipped well, didn't make a big stink about it... and that was that.... I'd definitely come back...
author: Easter E.

description:
I really really wanted to give this place a 5-star....Beet salad delicious, Croque madame excellent, pommes de terre frites awesome, everything tasted sooo fresh....

But....it was very heavy and a bit unhealthy....Great for a treat, but not a place I would frequent if you're trying to keep it healthy....
author: B P.

description: I feel transported to Paris when I walk down Claude Lane to and past the tables, and up the stairs to this restaurant. Very simple and safe fare. The Pomme Frites (French Fries) are some of the best in the city. Nice plate of Charchuterie (sausages and pate) and good selection of wine. The ever helpful servers all speak fluent French. Great place for a lite meal and a glass of wine or a full dinner. They often have live music at night.
author: Deno M.

description: I really dig the alley restaurants in the Financial District. My food was perfectly cooked. I am tempted to give 5 stars but I need to see this place when it has the live jazz on the weekends.
author: Scott F.

description: Cafe Claude is an instant vacation back to Paris. The Cafe is quaint, excellent and charming. I ate outside under the outside heater on their sidewalk-, on the 1st balmy night of the season. The food is amazing. Wow what a perfect coco vin. The staff is french and there is live jazz, a meal and cool atmosphere.This is a true tribute to Paris city nights...
author: shelly m.

description:
Ok, I admit I can't remember much about my food. It was probably good, since I can't remember it being bad. Here's what I do remember though....

Sitting at the bar at lunchtime, the light doing weird things to the shadows in the weirdly shaddowed alley outside. The constant feeling that out of the corner of my eye I should be seeing an indoor palm tree and Humphrey Bogart sitting at the other end of the bar in a white tuxedo. The pleasant and chatty bartender, who was, mystifyingly, French. I remember the service being very good, the steak tar tare even better. If that's what I ordered I'd remember that for sure, but it wasn't. I remember the calming effect of the patio and a rare April San Francisco day with sun and not rain, and some charming company. 

For these reasons I think you should go (sunlight and company not included, some assembly required). I'm sure the food is good, but I was a bit too filled with caffeine and adrenalin to remember.
author: Graham D.

description: I was determined to eat here again on my most recent trip to the bay area, but I foolishly forgot to make reservations. That was a bad idea. It was near impossible to get in here and my fiancee was very annoyed (not at them but at me). They really pushed people around for us and they were able to squeeze us in on the patio out front. Ted almost left because he has this weird aversion to eating outdoors at a restaurant but I convinced him that it is worth it. And boy was it! I ordered the tuna again because I still have dreams about it and I couldn't miss out and Ted ordered the filet. He was cautious but it turned out to be outstanding. Again with the sauce business. The sauce on Ted's steak was so yummy I wanted to take a bath in it. I don't know what they are doing back there in the kitchen with their sauces but I. Am. Loving. It! Next time I am up North I will go back again. This time with reservations.
author: Tai F.

description: Loved it!! NOt touristy, tucked away in a small ally/street with great ambience! Live jazz on select nights provides excellent backdrop to Parisian cafe environment. Sat outside, quick service & delicious meal! Creme brulee delicious! =)
author: Annie S.

description: What a treat.  Thank goodness we managed to get a table without a reservation (we were on the early side---came before a show); we sat outside and enjoyed conversing with the people near us while we waited for our food.  (Great city ambiance.)  The food is so tasty; I ate the trout (yum) and devoured the creme coconut....The prices are reasonable!    The guy who sat next to us has been enjoying meals here for 16 years---that should say quite a bit!
author: Bananarama B.

description:
my mom's in town so we've been going to 4-star restaurants (according to yelp) all week long. out of the 5 or so restaurants i've tried so far, cafe claude has been the best... we went here for lunch on a beautiful day, so of course all of the outdoor seating was taken. the inside is a little bit too dark for my taste considering how sunny it was outside, but the food, service, drinks and decor were all satisfactory. 

i had a pasta dish with fish which was ok... but my mom had a chicken dish that was the special of the day and it was amazing! it was like chicken wrapped around goat cheese and it was one of those dishes that's yummy until the very end. i think it stood out even more because the chicken dishes i had at other places that week were all very dry... e.g. the chicken mole at colibri's (ugh) and the chicken tikki masala at metro kathmandu...
author: David P.

description: The service at Cafe Claude was quick, efficient, and quite pleasant. The food however ranged from mediocre to pretty good. I ordered the pork and bacon, upon suggestion from our server. It was dry and a little bland. My date ordered the lamb, and it was perfection. Wish I had ordered the lamb as well.
author: Shirley L.

description: I love this little bistro!  Tucked in among San Fran's business district it is a true discovery of casual French dining.  The menu is small, but carefully chosen.  The food is exquisite and affordable.  Oh, and yes, it is there that I had the absoulte very best cafe latte in the world!  The staff is cordial and discreet.  Outdoor seating is pleasant.  Indoor seating is rather small, a bit cramped, actually.  But, overall, a very pleasant experience.
author: Sparks U.

description:
Perhaps my expectations were too high.    The setting, ambience, and music were wonderful.   The service was good but not exceptional in any way.    The food was disappointing to say the least.   I had the sturgeon 'special'  which was lukewarm and overdone with a bland sauce---the petite onion garnishes were the only tasty thing on my plate.   My husband's lamb was luke warm and bland---his fava beans were the tastiest thing on his plate.                  Perhaps we had a trainee chef /cook  . . .
          If you want excellent French cuisine, head to Yountville's Cafe Jeanty.       And no, my uncle does not own it.
author: Alicia G.

description: Hit or miss... Dining with my wife, first course of tomato soup was fresh, smooth, nicely spiced. The caesar salad was dry, just lettuce and parmesan, no detectable dressing. For entrees, the coq au vin was fantastic, as attested by many previous reviews. Salmon was horribly salty, honestly I don't think I've ever sent a meal back that I just couldn't eat, but this was the one. The waiter seemed to think it was a problem with my palate rather than the dish, but did offer to replace with another dish. The replacement tuna was nicely prepared and presented, but just average, rather bland in flavor.
author: Mark C.

description: Yum Yum Yum... we shared the french onion soup, the potatoes gratinee and had a croque madame & a croque monsieur....just about as good as the ones we had in Paris!
author: Melissa G.

description: Waiters are cute here! But that's not the reason why I come here.. (well maybe sometimes) I love the croque-monsieur.. MmmMmm cheesy bechamel...
author: Juliane N.

description: The Escargot was my introduction to snails. I was hesitant but the flavours added made them tasty. Situated in a very cute lane.
author: Robyn G.

description: I've been here twice. The first time, I was blown away by the food and the service. The second time, not so much -- I actually ordered the same entree (the vegetarian lasagna) and it tasted different, more cheesy, less seasoned... it was weird. And the waiter was weird, and screwed up my friend's order, after informing us he screwed up someone else's order and confirming the order of my other friend. Anyways, I'd say it's a hit or miss, but definitely worth trying.
author: Richa A.

description: Had an 8pm reservation on a Friday night and things were in full swing when we arrived. The room we were seated in was small and very loud, the combo playing in the bar area made it very difficult to carry on a conversation. One waiter was serving the entire room so service was a bit erratic.  We started with a carafe of the Sancerre which was light and refreshing.  We split two salads between three people, the chevre and the maison.  The chevre was fine, but the maison was much better, delicately coated with a light mustard vinaigrette which didn't overwhelm the butter lettuce. For entrees we had the poulet roti (generous portion, but slightly overcooked), the saumon, (which was good), and the cod (the best of the three entrees, the vadouvan spice really enhanced the dish). We went with the waiter's recommendation of the Sancerre rouge to accompany the entrees.  (An uncommon pinot noir from the Loire region).  It was a disappointment at $68, a bit thin, short finish).  For afters we had the tarte tatin and a chocolate cake.  the tatin was a small round of curled up apples on a circle of crust, nothing memorable, the chocolate mousse-like cake was much better.  All in all it was ok, nothing I would return for.
author: Rosemary M.

description: Took a date here a while ago and had a lovely time. I liked the hidden location, with the exterior hanging lamps lighting up the dark but romantic alley way. not quite the Van Gogh painting, but almost reminiscent of it. the evening was made even more romantic with a jazz band providing the music and the waiters being friendly. tried the coq au vin for the first time and it was delicious. i remember my date having a pasta dish and i think she enjoyed it as well but the dessert wasn't too memorable. overall, it's still a good place to impress a first date.
author: Chris C.

description: I chose this restaurant as the place to celebrate my beautiful French boyfriend's 25th birthday.  Although the food was alright, the service extremely polite and the ambiance dark and romantic, I can't say that if it hadn't been Lo's birthday that I would remember it very well.  My Bavette Sauce Poivre Vert  was quite unremarkable and the dish's only saving feature was that it included a small side of the gratin dauphinois, which was delish.  The Moelleux au Chocolat  was scrumptious, but overly sweet and heavy.  My boyfriend did enjoy his Coquilles Saint Jacques, but remarked that his mum definitely made it with more flavor.  I must agree that I've had better food at Cafe Rouge chain in the UK.
author: Hiromi N.

description: Warm ambiance, live music (check schedule) and great food.
author: Kerri L.

description: Just finished lunch with four friends.....it was the next best thing to being in Paris.  Very nice menu with lots of choices, good service, pleasant outdoor seating....
author: Ann T.

description: The food here is really great. I had the salmon dish , and it was absolutely perfect.The Chardonnay I got with it was great, and I don't even like white wine so much. I also had the Tarte Tatin for dessert, and that was really good too ,even though it wasn't the best I've had. But my boyfriend's chocolate mousse was amazing. Even more, the place is in this little alley and it totally reminds me of Europe, and they have awesome music playing during dinner. Definitely a great place for dinner (when you have money to spend ;) )
author: Alexandra A.

description:
Wonderful atmosphere and pretty decent and affordable bistro food!  On most weekends, they have a jazz band playing.  Depending on where you sit, you're probably not sitting right by the band though, so it's not going to be super loud.  It's cozy - read, tight.  So you may find yourself staring at the food on the next table while you await your order.  Nevertheless, this place transports me to a warm cozy cool French bistro in Paris.  MINUS the cigarette smoke and snobbish Frenchies.  WONDERFUL.  :-)

For starters, we had the coquille st jacques and the escargots - great, smothered in butter garlic pesto sauce with puff pastry.  We mainly had the Steak Au Poivre for our entree, a classic French bistro dish.  In fact, that's how you judge if a bistro is good, by the steak au poivre (or steak frites).  Fries are so-so.

Overall, I'd say, Go for the atmosphere, stay for the music and have some of the yummy bistro food.  That would be a great evening!
author: Hoola H.

description: Great place to land if you happen to be in Union Square.  We happened upon the little alley way whie searching for food and it definitely exceeded our expectations.  The french onion soup (incredibly salty just the way I like it) and tiger shrimp appetizer were yummy, and the coq au vin and mushroom ravioli were decent.  The french fries were great - crispy and skinny.  I can see us going again if we happen to be in the area, but it won't become a destination spot.
author: l c.

description:
I used to eat here semi-regularly when I worked down the street about ten years ago.  My first ever croque monsieur was consummed here.  I liked that sandwich so much that my co-worker and I used the word "croquer" to mean "Let's go to Cafe Claude for lunch."  Fast forward ten years to my most recent experience there.  We arrived a little after 1pm, and the hostess told us that it would be about a fifteen minute wait.  The place was still full, but the lunch hour rush was dying down.  Most diners were finishing up and getting their checks.  We sat down after about ten minutes, with the expectation that we could order and be out of there in another thirty.  Big mistake.
Our waiter didn't come by after we sat down.  He served the tables around us, but he pretty much forgot about us.  Nothing irks me more than to see patrons seated after me having their orders taken before me.  This is exactly what happened that afternoon.  My dining companions and I pretty much knew what we wanted, so we gave the universal symbol that we were ready to order (menus down on the table).  That didn't work.  I had to have the hostess chase the man down.  Lunch ended up taking an hour and fifteen minutes for several other reasons I'm not going to get into at this time.  I should have known better.  Un dejeuner rapide?  C'est pas possible a Cafe Claude.  They also didn't have Orangina that afternoon.  C'est dommage!
author: Eating Sleeping T.

description: I've been here quite a few times and the last time was great.  We had appetizers, entrees and desserts and the entire meal was delicious.  I had been a few months before and was disappointed, but we tried it again and it is as good as I remember it in that old days!  We'll be back!
author: Lisa M.

description: Still one of my favorite alley restaurants in town. I like sitting inside during weekday lunch hours and outside in the evening. For some reason, when I'm there I'm always in the mood for sangria. Too bad, they don't serve it.
author: Kwan H.

description: Best onion soup in the city! Beware..I had a friend choke on the cheese loaded and baked on top...
author: Gina G.

description: Delicious food.  Wonderful atmosphere, live music is a plus here.  Good service.  Try it.
author: Janinius B.

description: Very good food, surprisingly reasonable prices.  I would definitely go here again!
author: Sam F.

description:
The food was great!  I had the prawn salad which was a much larger than I expected, and a side of fries, which were seasoned to perfection.

The atmosphere was very intimate and cozy, if not a little dark.  And cold, since for some reason in the middle of winter, they leave a window or two open.  I think I would have rather sat outside underneath a heat lamp.  They had a live band that played very well, not too noisy or obnoxious.  

Added bonus, we came here at around 8 30 or so on a weekend, and there was TONS of parking which I feel is practically unheard of in SF.
author: Alison K.

description: A mix of French styles that overall work quite well. Service is good, no real complaints
author: Ben G.

description: fantastic food - pate appetizer, seafood small plate and sea bass entree. knowledgeable and attentive staff despite being very busy.  make a reservation.  prompt seating. highly recommended.
author: Kelly H.

description: I love doing lunches here during the weekday.  The food is good and I love the ambience.
author: Julia H.

description: Really cute place with a great feel to it and the food is really good. I did find our dishes a bit salty (french onion soup and some wild mushroom pasta dish), but the manager really seemed to want to know about it and to keep it in mind for the future. Great service, friendly, sincere. I hear that every Wednesday from 5:00 to 8:00 pm is Ladies Night with drink specials and some small plates-- each for $2 each!
author: Dana B.

description: I love this little french bistro... I've only come here during several lunch occassions and loved the freshness of the food and the bloody mary's.  I've come here with friends and even on my own and just adore it.  A charming place to bring a date too if that's what you're looking for.  The service staff are all pleasant and your food does not take forever to come out.
author: Jenn C.

description:
good spot for lunch in a nice space

cozy is the word to use, but they actually have high ceilings

the food isn't anything spectacular, but there's great ambiance

don't feel like fighting it out in the food court? come here
author: Charles C.

description: For a french bistro where everyone is truly from France or a french protectorate, this is a nice place.  Mind you nice is the operative word.  The food is good but I am over cuisine nouvelle.  I want more than 2 pieces of lettuce in my salad, if you get my drift.  Great wine selection, good soups and very hip ambiance.  I think they could kick the food up a notch.  I lived in France, yet this is not the best spot this side of the pond.  Good for a starter date if you sit outside and it is nice.  If not indoors is a bit more intimate.
author: Nicole F.

description: We had an "ok to good" experience on last Sunday evening. Started with duck liver pate and truffle mousse, which were both very good. Afterwards, I had steak tartare and my boyfriend had coq au vin. They were good too. We were not sure if the gewurtzaminer was chilled enough and when our glass was empty we were not asked for another drink...although we would go for another if asked...Overall, it was a nice atmosphere and good food. But, we were surprised with what happened to the next table: After about 45 minutes they ordered, server came back and asked them if they had ordered, they were sure frustrated...Then somebody else brought their wine with the apologies but it was not what they ordered...Then, this person said it was the first day of their original server etc...I don't know how much  of it is buyable. Anyways, my overall impression of the place was just not 5 stars.
author: Burcin T.

description: Gotta love this place!  They have by far one of the best pomme frites I've had in the city (outside of Bix's pomme frites with truffle oil), and you'll find me here when I'm craving some fries, their dipping sauce is awesome!  The sandwiches are good for lunch, there's this one pate with black peppercorns that is awesome.
author: Lucky T.

description: Cafe Claude on Claude Lane. How quaint! I stumbled upon this gem walking the alleyways of SF one day and vowed to return. My wife and I had dinner here several weeks ago and would have liked to have eaten outside but it was to darn chilly. We didn't have reservations but they were able to accommodate us. I don't remember what we ordered but the experience is what I always remember. Dinner was tasty and the wait staff was excellent. Service makes all the difference in the world and that's how they keep me coming back. We will be back.
author: Hieu D.

description: Everything about Cafe Claude is awesome.  The location is great...small place tucked away in a narrow alley.  The food, totally unstoppable.  The pate plate is a good starter, and the steak tartare is unreal.  Had it for the first time here.  The pork tenderloin melts in your mouth and the risotto does the same.  The french onion soup is excellent, as expected.  Just order anything and everything...you can't go wrong.
author: Victoria G.

description:
After years of using Yelp, Cafe Claude inspired me to become a contributor!  We had a great experience tonight.  I can't imagine better French food at this price point!  Excellent service and good ambiance contribute to making this a 5-star choice.

Every dish was excellent.  I'd make a special trip back for the creme brulee.

Thanks Cafe Claude for a wonderful evening!
author: V B.

description:
i always enjoy eating here.  good food and friendly service.  one of my favorite dishes is the traute aux amandes.  a diner sitting next to me recommended it one evening and i ordered it the next time i dined; it was delicious.  

i heard a rumor that the dish might be discontinued with the change of chefs.  please keep it on the menu.  it is one of my favorite dishes and i'm sure it's a favorite of many other guests.
author: John H.

description:
Dinner there Aug 09. 
We were looking for a nearby  Sunday dinner spot now that many of the ones we have liked in the past have either gone out of business or not providing value.
We had been in Cafe Claude for weekday lunch previously but found it too noisy/busy.
Sunday dinner was perfect with the right degree of noise and activity.
Food was good and for the most part generous in portion size. My wife had Moules Mariniere with frites and the mussels were the best we have had in a long time including in France. Plump and sweet.
The wine list  bottle markup is excessive but a few decent buy exists. By the  glass pours seemed generous when scanning the other tables.
Service was very good.
Good location just a block from the Sutter Stockton garage
author: Tim H.

description: Cafe Claude needs to thank yelp.  If it wasn't for yelp I don't know who would even notice their is a restaurant in a random ass alley.  This is a nice date spot if you can find a date.  Since I am fat I can''t get dates so I have to eat with a cow.  The french onion soup was really good.  I'd eat 10 bowls.  The escargot was decent but it was overpowered by the garlic and butter.  I thought absinthe had better escargot cuz I could actually taste the snail plus I am biased with Absinthe.  If I could eat there everyday I would.  The tuna tartare was very good here.  I Think this was my favorite dish of the night.  It was mixed with goat cheese and a raw quail egg.  It had an interesting but good texture.  The Cock Au vin tasted like mexican mole sauce.  I have heard of cock au vin but don't remember ordering anywhere else before so I can't compare.  I may have had it a bistro jeanty but don't recall.  This dish is good but filling.  The cow and I enjoyed the small dishes more.  I am glad we only shared an entree.  Skinny cows think they are fat but in reality they barely eat anything.  I need to upgrade to a kobe cow.  Skinny cows aren't flavorful.  I had to try this place before going to Gitane.
author: Fatty A.

description: I've only been here once when a friend and I was looking for a place to eat late one night. The food is great, the steak tartare is prepared right in front of you. They have decent wine selection, friendly service, nice secluded location (you might have to look for it but it is worth it)
author: John T.

description:
i love cafe claude. a sweet non pretentious french cafe.
i bring local friends and out of town guests as well, and everyone loves it.
the food is great. the croque monsier and their quiche lorraine! yum. the coq au vin was a HUGE hit with a friend who KNOWS good coq au vin.
the wait staff is both polite and friendly. upon noticing my out of town guests, 2 different waiters really went out of their way to talk about SF. 
i can only speak for lunch -- the food is consistently delicious.
thank you cafe claude.
c'est bon!
author: Betty M.

description:
The food was excellent, 1 star less because I felt service could have been a little better or more attentive, felt a little rushed out. 

Cheese plate- very good 
trout- wanted to lick the plate- soooo good!!! 
dessert- tasted 3 kinds- good, but nothing special 

Great ambiance, and will definitely be back.
author: Chris J.

description: Hidden down a little alley way, I found this restaurant to be a pleasant little gem.  Every person who worked there was nice and pleasant so 5 stars for service!  The food was overall excellent.  My husband got some sort of steak and I got the coq au vin, which just fell off the bone.  We got some side dishes too and a bottle of wine.  The food, the ambiance (very romantic lighting and live jazz music!), the servers, the attention to detail (when my husband and I both returned to our table from washing our hands, our napkins were neatly folded) makes me think this is as good as it gets.
author: le n.

description: Quite delicious and a the jazz in the background creates a wonderful dining atmosphere. The escargot is yummy though the molten chocolate cake could have been cooked a tad more.
author: Sydney L.

description: Soo yummy like melt in your mouth steak and super awesome lamb chop meng. Portions are little small like model.......cheerleader.....something small meng. The waitress speak in french accent.....sooo cool meng. Table too small too....food come out tad slow too.....well worth wait meng. So solly if engrish no good meng just come over from duh Vietnam.
author: addoo d.

description: Since moving to SF 9 months ago, I have been looking for a French Bistro reminiscent of those I frequented in New York for favorites like steak au poivre and escargot.  I rarely get down to Union Square, but wanted to enjoy some of the Christmas lights and music, so my boyfriend and I headed to Cafe Claude for an early dinner.  First, the location is quite charming.  It is in an alley, but not a scary alley, more like an out of the way of the hustle and bustle alley shared with other smallish restaurants and bars.  We shared the chevre salad, which is the perfect size for sharing, and the pommes frites.  He had the steak au poivre, and I had a special of the day - lamb shank.  Both were quite good, and the service was attentive without being annoying.  It was a great experience, and we'll be back.  P.S. Make a reservation or go before 6 for dinner.
author: Leslie R.

description: What happened to this place?  It used to be my favorite downtown spot for lunch, but something's happened.  They replaced their old goat cheese salad for something that pales in comparison.  Best bet, just stick with the French Onion Soup (and be sure to stay clear of the Nicoise - the tuna will make you sick).
author: Julie L.

description: Cafe Claude's interior is quaint but vibrant, with warm colors, upbeat background music, and (apparently) dancing on the weekends.  The food here doesn't venture far from traditional French (our selections included onion soup, coq au vin, and foie gras), but it is French done well.  The crowd might be a bit uppity, and a filling meal will run you about $40 without wine, so Cafe Claude is probably best reserved for a date, formal dinner, or special occasion.
author: MScott S.

description: Tucked away in a little alley off of Union Square, this French Bistro serves some wonderfully classic cuisine. Live music on Friday and Saturday, so if a high decibel disturbs your digestion, go another night. Our server rattled off the specials with such a thick French accent, we had to ask him to repeat when he returned. If you have never tried Steak Tartare, this is the place to order it. They bring the ingredients and mix it at your table. The cornichons make all the flavors pop. The Coquilles St. Jacques were a little disappointing, in that there didn't seem to be any distinct flavors that stood out. Red beets, feta cheese, and snow peas are creatively presented in the Betterave. Gratin Dauphinous was a rich combination of potatoes, cream and Parmesan. Creme Brulee and Americanos were the perfect finish to a relaxing 3 hr. meal. This is a place I will add to my favorites.
author: Arlene C.

description:
This posting is an ammenment to a previous dining experience that I posted in early July.  Upon reading my negative review, the CC manager contacted me and invited me back to give Cafe Claude another chance.  I decided to make a lunch party/meeting out of it with my manager and co-worker, and the meal proved to be a mid-week afternoon delight for us all.

The service was fantastic, not just for our table, but for all of the tables that I observed outside.  The manager in addition to the wait staff made constant rounds to make sure that "finished" plates were removed and that beverage glasses were full.  We started our meals with a classic caeser salad, which proved to be a cut above the rest of the caeser salads that I've had with the cubed tomato.  My friend decided to try the cream of carrot soup,  which I thought was too pretty to eat.  Since I've always been partial to chicken (long running joke with my parents), I selected the Poulet Roti for my entree, and it was served with some of the freshest herbs that I've ever tried in a restaraunt meal.  The fresh rosemary inspired me so much so that I plan on adding it to some of my own cooking.  My mates chose the salmon, which looked equally appealing.  As compliments to the chef, there were no traces of the meal left on any of our plates.

To cap off the meal, I had a cappucino and twisted everyone's arm to try the creme brulee, which turned out to be my boss's favorite dessert.  She also proclaimed it the best she has ever had.  All the way around, it was a very enjoyable meal and I plan on returning regularly for lunch/dinner.

Additionally, I was very moved by the manager's course of action.  She truly cares about the place that she works at, and takes personal satisfaction in knowing that each and every diner walks away as a happy customer.  I don't like posting negative reviews, and I know that I wouldn't want to be on the receiving end of them. However, I sincerely appreciate the outstanding customer service that I received from  Cafe Claude.


Original review

"I've dined here one another time back in January, and I don't remember being overly impressed then and I definitely wasn't  impressed on my last visit.  My most recent visit was to celebrate the booking of my upcoming visit to Paris (yay!) and hopefully this dismal lunch wasn't an omen of things to come.  I ordered a croque monsieur with side salad.  The sandwich was soggy and incredibly greasy.  Also, affecting the sog factor was they put a fistful of soggy probably day old frites in the takaway box.  If my feet weren't hurting from the stupid shoes that I was wearing, I would have marched right back over to take the food back.  I think the other French places in the neighborhood are better."
author: Amy Z.

description: Another nice gem in the city I love. Charming, nice decor and atmosphere. Had a great time hanging out at the bar (really dig the zinc counter top) and listening to a great jazz combo. Haven't tried the food yet but I am definitely looking forward to it.
author: Gerald U.

description: Probably my favorite restaurant in the city to go to with friends. It's lively, fun, and so French. And the food is good - just the right amount of heaviness without being overbearing and nauseating. I've always had a great time here. The wine list is good - with a range of choices both in price and type/style; it's not hard to go through a few bottles. The jazz music on weekends adds another layer of general play to the evening. Service can be a little slow at times, but that is so French. Come here and be prepared to kick back and spend some time lingering over food, wine, and good times.
author: Sasha C.

description: OMG this place was surprisingly good.  I walk by it on my way home from work so I decided to go check it out and yum!  I didn't know anything about the place but I liked the outside seating in the alley I saw while walking by.  Salads were good, mushrooms were delish, and the tuna was seared perfectly and was also delicious.  I can't wait to go back!
author: Rise G.

description: I'm so glad this place was on opentable, otherwise I would not have found this gem!  I consider myself a French onion soup connoisseur and this place offers a soup that didn't let me or my boyfriend down.  We ordered the duck and the pork-both had AMAZING glaze sauces and were perfectly cooked!   Of course the presentation, menu, decor and service were great-an overall satisfying experience.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a good French place to go to.
author: Danielle M.

description: I have to say I am addicted to their onion soup. It my favorite. We went to dinner on monday night, unsure how things would go, being Bastille Day and all, i expected madness. Instead was treated with Lovely french jazz, awesome service, and one of the better dinners i've had in a long time. in 10 years Cafe Claude has not let me down. Although i do miss the clock of french curse words. that was funny.
author: cindy d.

description: Enjoyed myself. Took a date. She enjoyed herself. What am I going to do, complain? The tuna tartare was real nice. She had some crazy chicken concoction and she loved it. Maybe it's just because I'm so damn charming the whole experience was positively associated. Yeah everything was fine. Nice little cocktail selection. We were the last ones there but no one gave us flack. Not cheap though is it. But what is? I'll return sometime...
author: Nate L.

description:
My already-overdue first review of what is actually and very possibly my favorite eatery in San Francisco was originally only two lines long (though very enthusiastic!)... and that is wholly unacceptable. So I'm updating it now, a year later, to give you the full scoop on why Cafe Claude is so dear to me. 

First of all, I love their Soupe a l'Oignon, Steak Tartare, Coquilles Saint Jacques, and Escargots en Croute. (Last time the soup was a little disappointing, but I'm willing to overlook that since it was a busy night and life happens.) I'm a creature of habit when it comes to my favorite things, so I don't typically stray from those options... But I've tried others' dishes and I can honestly say that pretty much anything you get here excels in both quality and quantity, so you're bound to find something to suit your needs or preferences. Most importantly, it's consistently fulfilling... as French cuisine, fortunately, tends to be.

The ambiance really does it for me though... As a Barcelonian, I often miss that quintessentially European atmosphere and they've really managed to capture that essence at Cafe Claude, from the decor to the lighting, so that's a lovely touch. Jazz evenings are delightful, unless you're trying to have an intense conversation, so that's something to keep in mind, but I personally enjoy it every time. The customer service is reliably good, ranging from polite to warm, depending on the person, but I've never had any complaints. While I've experienced and sincerely enjoyed eating outside on their alleyway tables, I love the atmosphere inside and typically prefer to stay in the warmth of their dining rooms... but both are excellent options, weather permitting. Ultimately, Cafe Claude works for every occasion, but is always uniquely charming, which is quite the accomplishment and, in my books, completely deserving of 5 stars... so with all my heart and stomach: merci, Cafe Claude!
author: G. J.

description: eating here makes me want to take up smoking and eat lots of cheese and say ooh la la.   the food here is excellent no questioning that.  add the very friendly staff, the jazz music, the outdoor heated seating, AND the drinks named after zizou and the 1998 champions of the world... and you've got a 5 star experience.
author: Bing S.

description: This place was great! The food was delicious.. But I felt like I wasn't getting my money's worth. The prices didn't match with the amount of food or service... But the sample that i received was great! (The fries were the best!)
author: Jo-Jo J.

description: Great dishes overall, classic stuff you'd find in any French cafe. Loved the beet salad, and seafood dishes are strong here. A bit quieter than Belden Lane, so good for romantic dinners.
author: Tami Y.

description: Paris in San Francisco? The atmosphere and ambiance at Cafe Claude exudes a parisian flare? Probably the best place to lunch in San Francisco......the quaint hidden location just adds to its charm.....non?
author: Sandy S.

description: Recently had a GREAT business lunch at this restaurant.  Great atmosphere.  Escape into an alley and suddenly you are in a European city.  Great service and the location is fun as it is tucked away in a small alley-way.
author: Todd S.

description:
Delicieux!  Savoureux!  All around merveilleux!

My boyfriend and I went to San Francisco last week for a little anniversary get-away, and went to Cafe Claude on a friend's recommendation for a fancy meal.  The location is simply perfect - tucked away in a little alley, you feel as if entering someone's charming secret hideaway.  I can't imagine many people stumble in by accident!  The restaurant is fairly small with modern decor, low-lighting, and lots of red.  I fell in love immediately!  The menu is fairly small, but boasts some mouth-watering options...whereas the wine list is quite extensive.  We were very pleased with our inexpensive bottle of red.  For nibbling, we shared a charcuterie plate with some excellent duck and pork pate, and for the main course, I indulged in some fusilli with roasted chicken and veggies.  Soooooo delicious!  I had an incredible and somehow fairly light coconut flan for dessert paired with a refreshing Bastille Bellini.

Overall, the experience was completely delightful - a perfect spot for a love affair with food!

Two major pluses - the prices are *very* reasonable and the French waiters are *very* adorable!!!

I wish we had such afforable French dining in Boston, but I will just have to visit San Francisco when I crave la cuisine francaise!
author: Victoria W.

description: I was pleasantly surprised by Cafe Claude. Good French bistro food, reasonable prices. It's pretty much all one can ask for.
author: Jeffrey F.

description:
Great place

I've never had french cuisine so i'm really new to the whole dark and gloomy atmosphere when i'm eating. I don't know if that's what they do in France or whatever, but it kinds of makes me wanna sleep. Luckily i was hungry, and i kept eating the bread so i wouldn't doze off. The waiter was nice and he kept helping me pour water everytime i'm at half glass. It's like they have some sorta alarm in the back where someone's water get half full and they beep the waiter, and he comes running. Like i said earlier, i've never had French food so i have no idea how it would taste like. Everything was new to me and it was good and it was satisfying. I don't know why, i but i couldn't stop eating the bread. It was either i was just hungry and just ate whatever but damn, that's like the most bread i've ever eatened. Plus, i like to dip stuff so those little cut up breads worked perfectly. I probably wouldn't go back on a regular basis, it's the kind of restaurant you try once and move on. I'll probably go there if it's like a special occasion or just some random nights where you're like "hmm............how bout them french fries" and then you're like "wait.....................french fries aren't french".

yeah....................o_O.......................randomness.

o yea, the welcomer chick (i don't know what you call them, welcoming person?) is pretty. So go there for the food, if not then just stand outside and oogle at the chick. Would be weird tho, just don't tell them that you read my post on yelp, cause i don't wanna get in trouble. You know what, don't do it, it's kinda creepy, at least order something for god sakes. Uh......just don't read my review, shoo, go away now please k thnx bai!
author: Will C.

description: My wife and I ate here with my good friend and his wife. Atmosphere gets a 4 stars, food 2-3 stars, service 4 stars. We actually came here because of the live jazz on the weekends. My review is a little biased as my best friends son was playing that night "Danny Grewen". We had  overall a  great time and if you get a chance you should try to catch Danny either here or somewhere else he really can blow  the trombone.
author: Joe C.

description: I went to Cafe Claude for the first time lat night, my date was raving about this place for awhile. Had a bottle of wine and 6 different appetizers, The pate and Escargot were the best. Service was very good too. I'm looking forward to try the entree next time.
author: Daniel W.

description: I ate here on one of those 90+ degree nights in SF.  Lucky for us the seating outside was plentiful.  For outdoor eating in SF I recommend this place.  The food was good and the waitress was really cool and fun to chat with about her native country.
author: Andrew N.

description: Before my best friend passed away, he introduced me to the best spots in the city when I just moved here. This place was one of them and we used to come here pretty often. The food is great and the service is good too. We always had dinner or brunch outside. Great cozy spot.
author: Liza A.

description:
Quaint setting off of a busy street.  Tables outside with umbrellas and heated lamps.  A sophisticated interior with white linens and dim candlelight.  I could not rave more about the dinner we had here.  It was a Friday night and amongst the hustle and bustle of downtown San Francisco we stepped into a cafe just like you would find in Paris.  
We were a dining group of 5 and shared two appetizers the charcuterie plate and the cheese plate were enough to entice our tastebuds.
For dinner we had the coq au vin pretty authentic and close to the famous now closed French restaurant Tres Coleurs.  The Lamb Shank was perfectly tender and the all green pasta was flavorful.  We had an excellent chataeu neuf de pape to go with our dinner.  
For dessert the highlight was the creme coconut.  The chocolate mousse was also great but it was more like a chocolate pot de creme to me.  The creme brulee and apple tarte tatin was also good.
I am looking forward to dining here again. I would definitely like to try this place for lunch one day when shopping in the downtown area.
author: Danielle E.

description: I love love this place. Whenever hubby and I feel like having good food and jazz. This is where you will find us. The location is a little hard to find since it is tucked away on Claude lane which I am not even familiar of. Our first time here was last year and we never forgot the place since. I think we've dined here three times now. A nice cozy atmosphere that reminds me of small brasserie in  Paris. The host although Italian and not French loves talking to patrons of the restaurant. My husband always end up ordering something different from the menu while I stick to the "Coq Au Vin" dish that I get and just pick on what my hubby gets. They have a good wine list for a small place. Great desserts and appetizers. Server's here are very good and not always in your face. They seem to know when to appear when your water is running low or you are at your last bite of your dish. Like what I mentioned this place is tiny and the tables are a little close to each other but that didn't bother us. To me it was cozy and comfy. Just talking about it makes me want to make another reservation. If you're in the area definitely give it a try.
author: JeanandFlo U.

description: I was really excited about having dinner here after reading all the yelp reviews, but I was really disappointed in everything I ordered.  I had the beet salad, which was a little salty, too much feta over the beets.  I was super excited about the steak tartar, but it was extremely overpowered by the olive tapenade that was mixed in tableside.  My trout was just ok, nothing really special.  The french fries were a little cold when they came out.  My friend's steak he ordered rare was well done.  My boyfriend had the lamb which also came out medium when he asked for medium rare, but he seemed to still enjoy it.  I left full, but not satisfied.
author: Sophie P.

description:
cute, quaint, this little nook provides a comfy little atmosphere and  guarentees a "bonjour!" at the door... it's my roommate's fav spot. the service was excellent and speedy although my friend and i came at 4pm on a tuesday afternoon when there was almost nobody sooo yeah...but we still enjoyed this hidden allyway spot.  the menu wasn't completely appealing though, we were starving and wanted more than pate and salad so we opted for the cafe monsiuer (i think that's how you spell it) which is an AMAZING ham and cheese sandwhich done on a level of yummy i cannot describe and arugala salad.  the ruby skye is really nice not too sweet, but if you like your citrus the #7 martini will do the trick, i would definitely go back but at night b/c my friend told me they hav a really good dinner menu 

1 star for the place and location
2 stars for the drinks served with the shaker
3 stars for the service
and 4 stars because i would go back and think they're better at dinner, and because i about died and went to heaven after the sandwhich
author: janice b.

description:
Ate here for my 2nd time ever & I am still impressed. Food overall & ambience were nice.

Had a potato/leek soup which was okay & probably shouldn't have ordered it since I wasn't that hungry.

My entree was fabulous - a medium rare lamb sirloin - perfection! Had the pomme frites again which were yummy, but the green beans were just slightly overcooked. Ordered the chocolate mousse again & it was much better & chilled this time around. 

This place did not disappoint!

******************************************************************

I've lived nearby for a long time & incredibly have never eaten here before last week. This place ROCKS & I can't wait to go back.

My friend & I shared dinner: pomme frites (oh my God -- so flavorful, the best fries I've had recently), steak tartare (yummy & prepared in front of you according to your preferences of ingredients/spiciness), and a pork dish w/peaches (so tasty & tender). Stuffed myself w/chocolate mousse which was nice but a little too soft for my liking -- I prefer it more airy vs. like pudding.

Will definitely return! The French atmosphere & French-speaking staff adds a nice touch.
author: D L.

description: I really love this place, it may be my favorite restaurant in the city.  It's got a great atmosphere with the jazz band, and french waiters.  The steak tartare, and coque au vin are tres MFing bien.
author: Daniel W.

description: This is my favorite french place, the outside seating is so euro and chill. There is good champagne and sparkling wine, not too pricy, bomb ass sandwiches, try the croque madam or the croque monsuier. I'm not a big ham person, but they are really good and not heavy and wont make you have to shit (like cafe de la presse). It's a chill place to have a late lunch/brunch. Haven't been here for dinner but would like to check it out. Would def go again.
author: Lacey P.

description: Went here with my out-of-towner boyfriend a couple weeks ago.  wasn't expecting the authentic french experience but it's what we got ,complete with the hot french waitors and their cute accents.  The food was delicious but rich and heavy (as french food in america tends to be).  beet salad was yummy, onion soup was good, coq au vin was spectacular and laden with butter.  same with the porc au miel except sweeter.  had the chocolate mousse for dessert....sooooooooooooo good.  great wine and espresso.  all in all a good time, good food, and great date at cafe claude.
author: Vonnie L.

description: Book matches it's cover.  The food is done well.  We tried the trout and the pork.  Both were done very nicely.  Trout was fresh and citrusy.  Pork was in a sweet, rich, and creamy sauce w/ caramelized apples.  Yum.  I wanted a quick, but tasty meal, and this expectation was met.  Good location, and average service.
author: K N.

description: This is my favorite place to have lunch when I'm around Union Square.  The Nicoise Salad is always excellent - and the "chocolate pot" is a very nice dessert.  The lunchtime menu prices are reasonable for what you get too!
author: J D.

description: This is the best little bistro in San Francisco, hands down. Great staff, incredible food, very, very romantic ambiance. Take a date you'd like to impress. Although not necessary, I highly recommend making a reservation. Also, while I am making recommendations, the arugula salad is simple and wonderful, the gratin dauphinois is worthy of a last meal along with the ravioli and the sauteed spinach, and PLEASE, for your own sake, try the moulleaux au chocolat, I cannot stop eating it (even if I've misspelled it). Outside seating is great too, and you can smoke at your table. Live jazz Thursday - Saturday.
author: Heather G.

description: Love this place. Staff are great. Food is fabulous. Out of the way location makes it even more special. I go as often as the budget allows :-)
author: Drew S.

description: I was meeting a friend downtown and as usual, stumped over where we could go that was nice, had some atmosphere and not insanely expensive but didn't feel like a cafeteria. Cafe Claude was perfect. The food did not change my life but it was yummy enough. I had the pork dish, which was really good. The pork was perfectly cooked and tender. The sauce was fine but the dish could've benefited from some vegetables or sides that had a contrasting color and texture. But the service was fantastic (really sweet, helpful waitress) and the atmosphere was great. Good mix of people, full but not noisey, grown up but not stuffy. It had a vibe similiar to Belden Lane, minus the tourists and hosts waiting outside trying to get you to eat there.
author: Robin M.

description:
We went here for Bastille day last week and it was like we left the US altogether - from the French speaking hostess to the French speaking patrons- the place had a great vibe and a lot of energy. 
This was our third time here and once again the food was great. I enjoyed cream of corn soup and flat iron steak while my fiance had trout and a green salad. The fish serving was very large and could easily have been a shared plate - so much so that the woman seated next to us saw our serving and changed hers to a shared plate. 
The cocktail list has a lot of sweet drinks which I don't care for so I asked for a recomendation for something crisp and fresh - our waitress recommended the drink with ginger and orange twist. If you want somethuing fresh - this is your drink...delicious! My only negative comment would be that the waitress never asked us if we cared for wine and by the time she came over giving us a chance to order it  - it would been too late into our meal. We will definitely be back.
author: Jan W.

description: Great little restaurant near union square. Hidden away in an alley so it can be a bit harder to find. A nice plus was that they had live music the night we went. The food was very good and I loved the chicken I had.
author: Luke R.

description:
this place is hard to find, but well worth the search in the cold.

a little on the pricey side, but amazing food.  the creme brulle is the definition of awesome!
author: Stephanie S.

description: We were on business and a mini vacation last week. We ate here twice. The food was excellent. The staff very friendly. You can't go wrong here.
author: Jan N.

description:
me likey! always good food, the staff is always very nice and accommodating, i am continuously pleased with this place i must say! 
it doesn't hurt that the staff is good looking either.
author: Ilovelife Z.

description:
Great atmosphere and ambience.  Noticed there were quite a few families w/ kids outside in the heated eating area, nice touch.  Kitchen for dinner opens at 5:30pm, though the bar area is open before.  

*Onion Soup:  yummy, not toooo salty, quite cheesy in a good way

*Brochette Salad:  wonderful parsely/ginger flavor on the shrimp, spicy mango was delish; could have gone lighter on the olive oil for the dressing base, but still very good

*Truffle Mouse:  good, but it was like any other pate I've had, could have done w/o it...I suppose I'm just not a pate guru

*Escargot:  I was expecting so much based on the reviews I was actually disappointed  :(  I like my escargot really garlicky and on the saltier side...something to dip extra bread into.  This wasn't bad, it just wasn't as good as I was hoping.  The puff pastry was a nice touch though, the flavoring was just too mild for me overall.

*Steak Tartare Large:  Had it done up medium spicy.  Very good, though they didn't mix at our table.  It was a LOT of tartare, but it was double the size of the Small for only $4 more, so it just seemed like a better deal  :)

Overall I'd recommend and will go back again.  I went w/ 1 person...we ordered the above.  We could order 2 less plates and still be full.
author: Cali G.

description: We reserved for 3 online at the last minute. Because we had to wait a while we were given a complimentary glass of champagne and a superb tuna appetizer. We were treated very graciously throughout. When we did order our food wall wonderful by all accounts. This place deserves its high ratings.
author: Ben M.

description:
I enjoyed the food and wine in this little restaurant tucked away in an alley way.  Had the tuna tartare, lamb, and ahi tuna.  All three dishes were so different in taste.  I'm not big on lamb, but the lamb wasn't bad at all.  Still perfer fish but for meat lovers the lamb has a nice texture.  The ahi tuna had a unique taste.  Try it and you'll understand what I mean.  

Tables are very close to each other.  I recommend making a reservation before you come.  I think the hostess needs a little more training in customer service.  She seemed overwhelmed but how can you be overwhelmed on a Tuesday night?  Anyways, I would recommend this restaurant.
author: K T.

description:
came here for drinks and dessert.  the jazz band was in full swing, and the atmosphere was romantic.  it's a great date place! 
the cocktails were delicious and the flourless chocolate cake was to-die-for!  they literally bake it after you order it, so the the first spoonful melts in your mouth.  the tarte tatin had a buttery, flaky crust.  yum!
the a la mode option was a mexican vanilla ice cream.  i didn't really care for it.  hopefully, they took it off the menu.  
i am definitely coming back to try a full meal here!
author: Big e.

description:
appetizer: Rillette du Périgord
dinner: scallop special (boyfriend), porc au miel (me)

Everything was FANTASTIC- food, atmosphere, SERVICE (this alone deserves the 5 stars). I savored every bite. I took in the mood of the alleyway restaurant. I enjoyed our waiter's personable demeanor. 

Just go... With over 500 reviews and a high rating, you can't go wrong.
author: Priscilla n.

description: The best hideaway/respite in the area, esp. after shopping. Nice, knowledgeable French (etc.) staff.  The duck foie gras is ace.  Perfect wine selection. And you you can smoke at the outdoor tables, which is compulsory in any proper French café.
author: Christopher T.

description: first all the place was great i was out for a weekend in SF with the GF. i love the setting: out door seating, jazz music, and etc. this place reminded me of city feel, since i am from LA there aren't too many place like this in La La land. the food was very tasty we had Pasta du Jour , Sauternes Mousse, and Escargot en Croute. the Sauternes Mousse which is goose liver that was amazing. not so sure if i would ever have Escargot en Croute again since i m not too much of an exotic eater. i also had the James Bond drink and that was good as well. the only compliant i have is that the seating is bit crowded so you can pretty much hear what ever one else is taking about, not made for an intimate conversation; nevertheless it is a pretty cool date spot.
author: Jason X.

description: Impressive food options.  Escargot has a nice pastry crust atop each individual snail (don't eww, if you eat shellfish, you'll like snail).
author: M T.

description: I went here for a 19th birthday dinner and was very glad I did. They accepted reservations and while it's a bit loud and crowded, it's still a pleasant atmosphere to dine in. The confit de canard was great. My boyfriend at the time spoke fluent French and the waiters were more than happy to speak it with him. We racked up quite a bill due to ordering some wine and cheese, but otherwise it was a reasonable, wonderful little restaurant that we both truly enjoyed.
author: Lisa N.

description:
My husband and I have eaten here twice for lunch and have thoroughly enjoyed every dish. On our first outing, my husband had a pork special and I had a salad (we usually share large dishes at lunch). His pork was great! Very tender, not dry, very good flavor. The salad was crisp and fresh. It was very crowded the first time we dined there and we were *right* next to 2 other couples, but it was cozy and fun. 

The second time we ate there we shared a pate (I can't remember which one but it was very good) and then shared the lamb sausage special. The sausages were served with lentils and small onions (I think they were martini onions... I don't know the exact name) and roasted peppers. This dish was soooo good I think we should have each ordered it. YUM. 

The service was descent. I wouldn't say it was the best that we've had, but I don't have  any complaints that I can recall. 

I would definitely go back. I recommend it for lunch/brunch. Not sure if I would go there for dinner, but it might be worth a try. I say it's a win win either way!
author: Lee G.

description: Nice, but I like Cafe de la Presse better. The lunch menu seemed somewhat slim on selection and was pricy. I had Salad Nicoise, but the same at Presse is much better. The atmosphere is nice, especially at the front booth surrounded by window.
author: Caitlin H.

description: I haven't been here in ages, so was really happy to see it listed here in Yelp.  It was pretty tiny when I used to go.  I discovered it after having just moved back to the States from France, and it was a very welcome surprise.  Try their Creme Brulee.  I remember their salads were wonderful too.
author: Juliette W.

description:
Place is located in an alley in downtown.  Place was nice and our waitress had a french accent. The decor was nice and the food was not bad not bad at all. 

 I had the coq du vin which was good but I thought alittle salty.
author: kenny l.

description: My favorite French restaurant in the city.  Its easy going, classy, and always changing things up.  If its not the pungent smell of a thick, wine-based sauce that lingers through the alleys that calls me to its doors its the live Jazz, wonderful cheeses, or absinthe that makes me return time and time again.  Also, the lunch menu is great and the best deal in town.  I give Claude four stars out of five for being satisfying but not too satisfying.  A balance worth noting!
author: Scott N.

description:
Stumbled into the cozy little alley and ended up having a v. nice weekend lunch here! We sat outside because it was a uniquely sunny day, and we couldn't let that pass unacknowledged. The interior is quite nice, though--very warm and romantical or whatever.

I was pretty into the food, frankly. And I do love French food. And I do so love goood French food. I had the salade nicoise, which was a little Americanized, but in a good way. The dressing was a kind of vinnaigrette rather than a traditional mayo based one, which I liked a lot better, and the tuna was seared rather than cooked through, which I liked a lot lot better than traditional nicoise faire. I spent a month in Nice once, and I ate a lot of shitty nicoise salads--Cafe Claude's version is my favorite thus far.

My friend had the Croque-Madame, which is a gruyere and ham sandwich with a fried egg on top (oh i missss Croques!), and it looked pretty damn good. She claimed that its appearance matched its taste.

For dessert we shared the moelleux, a dense and flourless chocolate cake. Man, whenever there is flourless cake on the menu, I always feel obligated to get it just because it's cake(!) and I never get to eat cake (CAKE!). It doesn't always pay off though, although this cake was spot-on. The cafe noisette (espresso with a tiny bit of creme was done sort of weirdly though--they just put like a half a teaspoon of foam on top instead of adding creme. The espresso was good though.

Only bad thing was that the outside seating is sooo close together that you really have no choice but to spend your time either purposefully ignoring or begrudgingly listening in to your neighbors. 

Price wasn't great, but wasn't awful either. Their cocktail and wine list looked good--I'll definitely force my friends to come back with me here.
author: Natalie M.

description: I came here to catch up with a friend over dinner and drinks. Wonderful pomme frites and endive salad. The endive salad was lightly dressed with the blue cheese "dressing/vinagrette" so it didn't overpower the other ingredients. Nice wine selection (either by the glass, carafe or bottle) and an extensive cocktail list. Service was great. Since it's tucked away, it wasn't as touristy as I had expected.
author: Jennifer T.

description: Charmingly tucked away from the hullabaloo, but menu has declined.  Steak tartare has taken a turn for the worse.  Haven't seen my top shelf waiter last couple of times.
author: Nate B.

description:
Recently had dinner here - great food.  The Coq au Vin was excellent.
Nice atmosphere- hope to return soon.
author: Kathy M.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in SF.  for price, food, atmosphere and service, I have yet to find any place that pleases me more.  The menu isn't that extensive but the entrees are delicious (pork loin, lamb, steak tartar) and the truffle mousse is to DIE for.  the other pates are not so great.  I've loved every wine i've tried there, the chocolate dessert is out of this world and i go to this place for every special occasion.  Oh, and the drinks!  my god the drinks!  amazing.  they also have live jazz a few nights a week.
author: Ray W.

description:
I had dinner last thursday, it was magic! The food was amazing, i had tuna tartare and for my entree seabass, my wife, she had steack tartare ( the best in town ) and cicken with french red wine, spectacular! The best part of the dinner was our server, it was such a good seller, in a good way, his smile and his positive attitude made our night! He adviced to has a splendid bottle of red wine, i remember very well the name" Gigondas ", i don't  know what that mean but it's very good!!! 
Beautifoul night, 5 stars for sure! 
If you want go there, go on thursday and saturday why? Live jazz of course.... Almoust forgot, ask for the italian waiter!!!!
author: robert l.

description: Stumbled on this place wondering around downtown. Great flank steak, decent (old world) wine list, and good service. It's fairly pricey though.
author: Michael M.

description: I found this place on the recommendation of a French friend living in SF, and wow was he right.  Pretty much everything is good, but the coq au vin is outstanding, and if the mushroom soup is on the menu, don't share it with a friend, get two bowls, because you will want yours all to yourself!!
author: Wendy S.

description: Cold winter day with lovely onion soup and a bubbling-hot potato gratin. Intimate settings inside, although it seems like it could get loud when full. Servers were all great, very attentive and pleasant.  The nibble of dark chocolate alongside the cappucino was a perfect touch.
author: John D.

description: I have to update and add a star because I do love Claude and the manager contacted me to try to make this right.
author: Danielle T.

description:
Great place!!

Reserved for a party of 6 on Friday evening on Thursday afternoon - quite difficult at other places, but the manager squeezed us in! The food was DELICIOUS! Desert was like a dream, the wine very good. They even have a good selection of desert wines. Prices are definitely OK for the great quality and the attentive service!
author: Niki C.

description: This is a really cute restaurant.  They play Jazz on Th, F & S nights.  So the music added to the ambiance.  I think it's a romantic lil restaurant.  The food was really good.  The service was really good too.
author: S. L.

description:
I LOVE CAFE CLAUDE. It has such great food. I love it every time I go and never have had a bad meal or a bad item. Their soups and salads are out of the world. The specials are always great and if you love pate, this is the place to go. They always season their dishes just right. Just enough rosemary on the lamb so you can taste both. 

When I worked downtown and was having a bad day, a lunch at cafe claude was just the pick me up I needed. Whenever friends from France visit we always take them here for a meal and they love it too.
author: Gary G.

description:
It was my first time trying french food and dine about town. We ended up ordering off the dine about town menue. Cute little French place. I made reservations on Opentable and Cafe Claude made my group wait  40 minutes but they gave us free dessert wine and appologized all night. The food is amazing.

Try the french onion soup, flank steak, french fries and all the desserts!!!!!

5 Stars for the blueberry mojitto!!!!!!
author: Leah P.

description:
cafe claude ... 

*shakes head & closes eyes* = what a BIG FAT, sad, disappointment ... jeez louise... iono about YOU all, but cafe claude didn't do it for me ... 

i've heard ENDLESS, NUMEROUS HIGH RATINGS about this hidden "gem" ... key word, "heard..." didn't find this on yelp or skim through the reviews, but rather so, from my personal circle of friends ... even saw it on all those foodie magazines, Yelp -- i say this place is a gem because it's seriously SO* hidden in between this lil alley way between bush & sutter... o gawd, it was a disappointment...

came with 2 other folks, and i must say, i enjoyed my company to the max ... otherwise, this would have been a 1 star ... =D not to mention, J ... thanks for being sucha fine gentleman ... awwwwwww... lol ... hehe ...

ambiance is great. cute lil charming cozy place ... very Parisian ... it opens up with a dining room with expansive ceilings adorned with endless prints of Paris and vintage movie posters giving this authentic feel but then again, the food.. the food tends to throw you off ...

service was awful ... SO SLOW, and none of that, "how is your food sir? how is your food ma'am? do you need anything else?" none of that ... simply, they drop your dish off and they run off.. whether you say "excuse me" or not, they're literally off to a different table. how rude.

the food is VERY french ... EXTREMELY RICH & HEAVY ... 

*$13 brochette (blk tiger prawns w/mixed greens) the shrimps were mighty juicy, but the mixed greens were drenched with too much oil, and left my lips all oily... 

*$16 charcuterie plate (selection of 2 types of meats w/pickled veggies) this was fantastic. the meats were super tender, thinly sliced and good.. you can easily buy this meat at your local grocery store.

*$19 porc au miel (pork filet, green beans, caramelized apples, white balsamic vinegar) have to say, this was quite tasty ... the apples were a lil bit TOO sweet...the green beans were cooked quite well ... 

*$20 coq au vin (chicken marinated in red wine, bacon, mushrooms, onions, and potatos)... never again. you could barely make out your chicken... it was literally drenched in black sauce, and had to dig to your plate for some meat... took 2 bites, and put my food to rest, and not to mention, careful, when you touchyour dish. almost burned my fingers off.. (minus major points to the server for not even warning me. stupid bastid!) and where was the bacon? where was the mushroom? none of that...

*$23 agneau (roasted lamb sirloin, beans, tomatoes, garlic w/rosemary garlic sauce) -- i'm just not fond of lamb, and it was cooked a lil bit rough...

*$5 pommes frites (there's a reason why people say this is a MUST have..) have to say, it was sadly, the best one of all the ones we ordered this evening ... AND it was sadly, the CHEAPEST ...

all in all, my fellow lovelies were not thoroughly impressed ... i seriously hate to say this but it's true ... did i just happen to come in a wrong night or something? iono, but i ain't gonna come back...
author: Jennifer S.

description: i just recently came here and i had such a wonderful time! a lovely little french place with jazz and outdoor patio seating tucked in an alleyway. romantic and charming with well-prepared food, i'll be back for sure!
author: Michelle I.

description: oh la la! fantastic coq-au-vin. could not believe how savory it could get. exactly how much red wine went into this dish? chef did an excellent job reducing it down and really making it unforgettable, just check my waistline. the endive salad started out the meal quite nicely, dressing wasn't too overwhelming and goat cheese added a nice kick. wife loved the onion soup. we took three hours here catching up with an old friend-
author: Jesse W.

description: I originally used Yelp to find this place and had very high expectations after all of the amazing reviews. The whole experience was fabulous. i honestly think the best part about this place is the fact its literally in a small alleyway with 2 other restaurants. It's a beautiful restaurant, the servers and staff are actually french, and the food was incredible. reasonable prices for the quality of food. i had the french onion soup and the Chevre salad. Both were out of this word. Highly recommended! Definately dont go with a large group though.
author: Lindsay S.

description: We went for a late lunch, unfortunately it was a limited menu, but what we chose was great. I had the arugula salad and my girlfriend had the beet salad. The Charcuterie plate was good wasn't great. The oysters were great! Service was wonderful. We'll definitely be back to have dinner.
author: Heidi C.
